review_text:
I had such an incredible dining experience at Mission Ceviche! The food here is next-level — beautifully presented and absolutely bursting with flavor.

I ordered the ceviche, and it was to die for. Fresh, vibrant, and perfectly balanced — easily one of the best I’ve ever had. The “trust latches” (the crispy fried bites served alongside) were equally amazing, a must-try combination. Every dish was plated with such care and creativity, making it not just a meal but an experience.

The atmosphere is warm, modern, and stylish — perfect for enjoying authentic Peruvian cuisine with a contemporary touch. On top of that, the service was outstanding. Our waiter, Louis, went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience. He was so attentive, helpful, and genuinely welcoming, which made the meal even more enjoyable.

If you’re in the area, I highly recommend stopping by Mission Ceviche. Whether you’re a fan of Peruvian food or trying it for the first time, this place will absolutely impress you. I’ll definitely be coming back!
owner_response:
Hey Robert, 

Wow, thank you for your kind words! We’re so glad you enjoyed the ceviche and the atmosphere at our restaurant. Louis will be thrilled to hear your feedback! We can’t wait to welcome you back for another lovely experience.

The Mission Ceviche Upper East Side Team

review_text: Up Thai is one of the best Thai spots around! The food is always fresh, flavorful, and beautifully plated — the pad kee mao and green curry are my go-tos. The place has a warm, stylish vibe, and the staff are super friendly and attentive. Great for both a casual meal or a nice dinner out. Always a great experience every time I go!

Life brings us to the City regularly lately, so we always try a new 'positive' before the trek home. Up Thai was a wonderful discovery! Happy, laid back atmosphere, coupled with pleasing, comfortable surroundings..and then there's the food. Fancy, delicious and memorable! Lucky us!!

배부른 상태에서 그래도 좀 먹으려고 갔는데 맛있었어요.
팟타이에 스프링롤은 국룰이죠~!!

review_text: What a great place, I came here to celebrate my anniversary after we finished chemo at MSK! And it felt so nice to be cared for!
WOW WOW WOW - die besten Frühlingsrollen, die ich je gegessen habe. Für New York ist Preis-Leistung echt top. Auch das rote Curry und der fritierte Reis sind sehr zu empfehlen.
review_text_translated: WOW WOW WOW - the best spring rolls I've ever eaten. For New York, the value is really great. The red curry and fried rice are also highly recommended.

review_text: The best Thai food in town. 5 stars.
The food is consistently great (I recommend the massaman curry with chicken).  Our server, one, was friendly and efficient.

This is the best Thai food I’ve ever had. Amazing atmosphere, the pad see ew, chicken khao soi was phenomenal. I loved my Thai iced tea. The servers are so friendly and helpful. Oliver’s recommendations and friendly demeanour really made our experience stand out. I give this an 11/10. Go here, go here, go here. Trust me, you won’t regret it.

We placed a reservation with OpenTable ahead of time. Food was excellent, we ordered 2 Kee Mao’s with Chicken medium-spicy and 2 Thai Iced Teas. Staff was really friendly and attentive, must recommend for Thai food. Place was well decorated.

Where do I begin, I just happened to stumble upon this gem that has been here for 13years. The Menu is phenomenal, we had the short rib and soft shell crab on the summer special menu and everything was 10/10. The only thing I regret is not getting the mango salad branzino, but I will be back!! Thank you so much to Salina, for being so helpful with answering any questions we had and making wonderful recommendations! Salina really added to our overall positive experience! The chefs menu is also stellar. This is my new Thai go to spot, also affordablish prices!
Always excellent. Go-to Thai spot in the city
The food was so delicious- the Panang was so flavor, the perfect blend between sweet and spicy!

Terrific food!  My squid, chicken, and shrimp suki was spectacular.  Exactly the right amount of slow building heat.  The duck bao - to die for.  And the Hanoi Fizz was a smoky delight.   Loud and friendly atmosphere. .  Hard seats - bring a cushion if you want to.  The friendly service will smile.
So fresh, fast, affordable. When visiting NYC we eat here atleast 2X every trip

New favorite spot! Absolutely love the atmosphere and the food was great. Its reasonably priced as well. Can't wait to come back. Ow my gosh the lunch menu was bomb, the creamy soup i had was delicious and the flavor was amazing. The pad thai super soft and delicious. The milk tea was EXTREMELY sweet but that's fine
Beautiful setting and delicious food!

They never bring enough rice on purpose to force you to order more to jack up the cost higher
the panang curry is great but i can't deal with the exorbitant cost anymore
super happy to try this place out! the best meal I’ve ever had in NYC since I’ve been here for 4 days. good food, good drink, good music, good service.
Selena was the best she took very good care of our large party and was very nice. S
Salina was an amazing host!
Good was amazingly delicious.
Salina was a great, attentive server!

I ordered three dishes for the table, including the Clay Pot rice, Pad Thai, and steamed mussels. Every dish was a hit. My favorite was the clay pot rice, a definite must have!!

The dishes tend to be sweet, but my mom felt it tasted too salty, so there’s definitely a cultural component to how you might perceive the food. When we arrived, it was starting to get busy (around ~5-5:30), so the workers started to set up a second location for dine in. My group of three ended up on one of the outside tables by this second location. I really appreciate Up Thai’s interior design so I was a little disappointed with not being able to show my family inside. Otherwise, dining outside went really smoothly. Servers paid thorough attention to customers outside, so I did not feel like we were lacking anything in comparison to sitting inside. In fact, one of the waiters reminded my family that Clay Pot rice was best enjoyed mixed, so they are pretty attentive to detail.
I have eaten 5 times at Up Thai. I find all dishes to have great flavor. The service is also excellent.
That was an eye-opening food experience. We received a friendly hello when we entered. Their cooking stands above average. This spot embodies community values. The positive reviews are well-founded.
Lunch Special 주문했고, 양 충분했어요. Pad Thai, Basil Fried Rice 둘 다 너무 맛있었어요. 한국인이라면 호불호 없이 좋아할 맛입니다.
review_text_translated: I ordered the Lunch Special, and it was a generous portion. The Pad Thai and Basil Fried Rice were both delicious. It's a flavor that any Korean would enjoy.

review_text: El lugar muy lindo y la comida todo muy rico
review_text_translated: The place is very nice and the food is all very delicious.

review_text: delicious and cheap entrees!!

The food was excellent and authentic.  The spicy was indeed SPICY! Surprised to find such flavor in the UES.  The service was wonderful.  Our server was from Bangkok and was sooo sweet.

Ordered the Steak Salad with fresh herbs and sticky rice for an appetizer.  10 out of 10.

Crispy Duck green curry and Kee Mao noodles were better than standard!!! Excellent!

The best Thai spot! The food here was amazing, cannot recommend the panang curry with chicken enough. Also the Thai iced coffees were a hit. The restaurant was decorated beautifully and felt very cozy. Prices were super reasonable as well!

Another great Thai restaurant in NYC! The flavors weren’t mind-blowing or life-changing, but everything was executed very well.

We got the mango avocado salad, the clay-pot fried rice, and the soft shell crab in red curry from the summer menu.

Our favorite was probably the mango avocado salad—it had a perfect level of spice and acidity to complement the rest of the meal. The clay pot fried rice was a bit underwhelming for me. Although the blend of different types of meat offered great textures, the flavor was uniform throughout the entire dish—everything tasted like sweet soy sauce or eel sauce. The soft shell crab curry was great and tasted just as expected.
everything was sublime. few places can make their food as delicious as it is visually stimulating; Up Thai succeeds in both regards.
Great experience and food. Our server was Four
Great server: Four! And great food

Great experience at Thep Thai! The food was flavorful and came out quickly, and the service was top-notch. Our waitress, Four, was incredibly friendly and attentive — she really made us feel welcome. Will definitely be back!
The food was flavorful and came out quickly, and the service was top-notch. Our waitress, Four, was incredibly friendly and attentive — she really made us feel welcome. Will definitely be back!
our server, four, was great!! food came quickly and everything was amazing. would recommend

Four's service was amazing! The flavors remind me of my trip to Thailand.
Thep Thai! The food was flavorful and came out quickly, and the service was top-notch. Our waitress, Four, was incredibly friendly and attentive — she really made us feel welcome.

I’ve had the crab rangoon, shrimp pad Thai, Khao Soi, and chive massaman dumplings from here and they were all delicious! Our food arrived under 10 minutes of placing the order and our server, Anna, stopped by shortly after we started eating to ensure everything was good. I even dropped a spoon and another waiter swung by with a replacement without me asking. The interior is very cutely decorated with hanging plants, if a little louder, but outside seating is perfect!
The food is delicious, great vibe and our server, Anna is really great!

Had the chicken Pad Thai and the Khao Pad Mun Nua, both were excellent, flavorful, and cooked just right. The service was quick and friendly. Our server, Four, was especially attentive and welcoming, which made the meal even better. Definitely recommend this spot.

This is a MUST go place when I visit NYC. I love everything about this place and highly recommend it! The food is delicious, my always favorite: Massaman Curry and everything else!

Also, the food styling makes it look even yummier

Thep Thai is the best Thai food in UES and one of the best in the city. I've been eating here for the last 5 years, I'll always recommend Thep Thai. They are very efficient, food is very tasty, great service and nice atmosphere. Best Thai Food in UES.

Gift was our server, she was super friendly and attentive. 5 stars.

Absolutely loved our dinner at Thep! The atmosphere was vibrant, the food was delicious, and the service was top-notch. The khao soy curry was soooooo creamy and delicious! A special shoutout to Gift, our server—she was friendly, attentive, and made sure everything was perfect throughout the meal. Highly recommend this spot if you’re in NYC and craving amazing Thai food. We’ll definitely be back!

If you’re in the mood for authentic, flavorful Thai food, THEP is the place to be. Located on a quiet corner in the city, this cozy spot serves up some of the most mouth-watering Thai dishes I've had in a long time. And my dining experience was made all the more delightful thanks to Minnie, the waitress who made me feel like I was dining at a friend’s home.

Fantastic experience! The food was delicious, the service from Minnie was friendly, and the atmosphere was great. Everything came out fresh and perfectly cooked. I’ll definitely be coming back and recommending this place to friends!

review_text:
The food here was meh. I got the lettuce veggie burger. It was mushy and not that flavorful. Wouldn’t recommend. The fries that came with the dish were decent though.

I also thought the bathroom was not the cleanest.
Incredible food, and really accommodating for my two toddlers. Will definitely be back
The waiter Josner and bartender Adela we had was incredibly nice. Amazing food and dessert
Amazing experience. The food was great. The bartender Sela and our waiter Josner were outstanding. What a great hummus!
I was looking for a new place to try and found this great restaurant the food was good I had the lamb chops, but definitely service was great, the bartender Elif was great, friendly and Attentive.
owner_response: "Thank you so much for your kind review! We're so glad you decided to try us and enjoyed the lamb chops. We're especially happy to hear that Elif made your experience even better with her friendly and attentive service. We’ll be sure to pass along your compliments to her. We hope to welcome you back soon for another great meal!"

review_text: Our waiter was tremendous - excellent ambiance!
I went for dinner with my husband and had such a lovely time. Josner was an excellent server, very attentive and kind. I highly recommend trying the Lamb Shish Kebab — it was absolutely delicious!!!
The live show is absolute amazing. Their non alcoholic drink surprised me.
The baklava is delicious and the service is eggselent

Our server Josner was amazing all his recommendations were really good I’m definitely coming back, thank you so much for the hospitality. I went above and beyond with the food recommendations, was my first time here and I’m sure it’s not going to be the last. I love the old good hospitality and Josner gave us that and more. Thank you again!
Amazing
friends birthday dinner was here, such a vibe and great drinks/food
I went here for my birthday and had such a great time! Beautiful atmosphere, great service, and impressive food! So delicious!
Great experience!! 10/10
My friend’s birthday dinner was here and it was amazing!!!! so much fun!!!
Came for a casual date night – the Grilled Mediterranean Chicken with thyme glaze was tender and flavorful. Low-key, cozy vibe with soft music.

Overcharged our party.
$20 a glass of rose while it was order after 4pm happy hour.
Didn’t want to make a scene since we were treating friends but will never return.

From the moment we walked in, we were in great hands with Okan, the manager.

He has a natural for hospitality, warm, professional, and incredibly attentive.

He managed every detail with ease, made sure allergies were handled perfectly.

The food was great. The Greek salad was crisp, fresh, and seasoned just right.
The Branzino was excellent, flavorful, and somehow both light and filling at the same time.

The atmosphere is lively and inviting and the service is good

I recommend Blue Mezze Bar (Zoi) and if you are lucky enough to have Okn take care of you, you are in for a fantastic experience.

Main entreeFood orders for our party arrived over a 45 minute period even though the menu was limited.  Food was not cooked to proper temperature and some items had clearly sat waiting to be delivered.  Would not recommend.
owner_response:
Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed the salmon, risotto, and asparagus, and that our team made your experience pleasant. We appreciate your feedback about the outdoor seating and will certainly look into updating the chairs to make your next visit even more comfortable. We can’t wait to welcome you back next time you’re in the UES!
– Blue Mezze Team

review_text: Terrible service. I had to get up 4 times from my table to reach out to the host, who was ignoring guests and chilling on his own. Never gonna come here again. If there was a 0 rating, I would give that!!!
Rude and ignorant bar tenders

Was there a few weeks ago for a Saturday evening dinner.    Everything was excellent.   We tried going for brunch on Sunday with a very different experience.      I made a reservation for four people at noon.     When we showed up for our reservation it was really raining hard.     They told me that my reservation was for outdoors and we could sit outside if we wanted.     Other than that, they would not honor our reservation.      In my 60 years of making reservations,  I have never had someone do that!  So very rude.   It’s a shame because the food is good.
owner_response:
Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We're glad to hear you enjoyed your Saturday dinner, but we're truly sorry to hear about the issues with your brunch reservation, especially given the weather. We strive to accommodate all our guests and apologize for any inconvenience or frustration caused by the misunderstanding about your reservation. Your feedback is important to us, and we'll be addressing this to improve our service. We hope to have the chance to welcome you back and provide the seamless experience you deserve.
– Blue Mezze Team

review_text: What a beautiful outdoor cafe! My salmon w the risotto and asparagus was SO tasty, and the waitstaff was super nice. The chairs outside were comfy / padded but a little faded / worn, so those could use an update, but all in all, 5 stars and when I’m in the UES next I’d totally come here. Very pleasant experience.
owner_response:
Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're delighted to hear you enjoyed the salmon, risotto, and asparagus, and that our waitstaff made a positive impression. We appreciate your feedback about the outdoor seating and will certainly look into updating the chairs. We look forward to welcoming you back next time you're in the UES!
– Blue Mezze Team

review_text:
I recently dined at this Mediterranean restaurant and had a wonderful overall experience.
The ambiance was excellent — elegant, modern, and very clean. The decoration felt refined and fancy, creating a welcoming yet upscale atmosphere.The food was truly the highlight of the evening. The tuna tartar was absolutely delicious, fresh and perfectly balanced. The octopus was tender and flavorful, while the salmon was simply outstanding. Every dish showed great attention to quality and preparation.The only disappointment was the limonada. It lacked the freshness and flavor expected and didn’t quite match the otherwise high standard of the menu.The service was attentive and friendly, making the experience even more enjoyable.While the restaurant was spotless and beautifully decorated, the bathroom did not live up to the same standard as the dining area. This is an area that could definitely be improved to better align with the restaurant’s overall image.
Despite a couple of small drawbacks, I left very happy with the food, the service, and the environment. I would definitely return for another meal and recommend it, especially for the outstanding dishes.
owner_response:
Thank you so much for sharing your detailed and thoughtful review! We’re thrilled to hear you enjoyed the ambiance and found the atmosphere elegant and welcoming. It’s wonderful to know the tuna tartar, octopus, and salmon stood out as highlights of your meal — our kitchen team will be delighted to hear that!
We appreciate your honest feedback about the limonada and the bathroom, and we take these comments seriously as we strive to provide an exceptional experience in every aspect of our restaurant. Your insights help us improve and maintain the high standards our guests expect.
We look forward to welcoming you back soon for another memorable meal!
— Blue Mezze Team

review_text: Kaya was amazing and made our experience so amazing! 10/10!
owner_response:
Thank you for the kind words! We're so happy to hear Kaya made your experience truly amazing. We’ll be sure to pass along your 10/10 praise! Looking forward to welcoming you back soon.
— Blue Mezze Team

review_text:
I live on 71st and 2nd Ave and I have been in a few times and it’s always a pleasure. The staff are friendly and are quite attentive to detail.  The hostess Veronica is awesome - my friend left his umbrella last time  and she saved it and remembered that I had called about it ! Quite an impressive memory I’d say.

I always sit at the bar when I come in , the seats are comfortable and the drinks are solid. They serve a Sancerre by the glass which I greatly appreciate and enjoy. The bartender Elif is excellent. She knew the food menu and made great suggestions.  I’m in the restaurant business and she cranked out service drinks to the busy tables all night and didn’t seem to break a sweat.

Overall it’s definitely worth giving a shot if you live in the area,  I am always more than willing to pay whatever it is if the quality is there - Blue Mezze Bar delivers.
owner_response:
Thank you so much for your thoughtful and detailed review — it truly means a lot coming from someone in the industry!
We're thrilled to hear that each of your visits has been a pleasure and that our team continues to make a positive impression. Veronica will be so happy to know her attentiveness didn’t go unnoticed, and we’ll be sure to pass your kind words on to Elif as well. Her dedication and professionalism are exactly what we strive for, and we're lucky to have her behind the bar.
We appreciate your continued support and look forward to welcoming you back soon — your seat at the bar (and glass of Sancerre!) will be waiting.
— Blue Mezze Team

review_text: Great spot for Mediterranean food! The flavors were fresh and authentic. The vibe is cozy and welcoming, and service was friendly, just a little slow at times. Overall, really solid meal.

We appreciate your patience with the pace of service and will work on tightening things up to make your next visit even better. Looking forward to welcoming you back soon!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text:
Appalling service from the bartender today.

We came in for a quick dinner (couple with a young child). Our daughter was starting to act up after a long day of being out and about so we cut our order short realizing it was going to be a challenge having ordered some food for her and my wife in-advance already.

We ordered a main and a side and a glass of bubbly and the waiter visually and verbally got upset at us and shook his head and said "really just two items" and stormed away. Didn't realize there was was a minimum spend requirement and another couple beside us just ordered a burger to share and nothing else yet didn't receive this sort of treatment..

Absolutely unprofessional behavior from the bartender and maybe needs to be reminded that he's in the hospitality business. The place wasn't even that busy to begin with so it's not like we were hogging up valuable real estate.

Food was average - it's a neighborhood type feel with its own charm but definitely won't be coming back based on the bartenders disgraceful attitude.

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text:
One of the most disappointing dining experiences we’ve ever had. Not coming back.

We waited 45 minutes to over an hour for our food with zero updates. Halfway through, we were told they had run out of fries, which were supposed to be included with the meals. Instead of offering any kind of reasonable solution, we were given just two options: cancel or order the food without fries at the same price — no compensation, no apology.

We chose to replace the fries with vegetables (the only alternative available), only to find out they charged the vegetables as a paid extra — even though fries were included in the original dish. So we ended up paying more for less, simply because they didn’t have something essential on the menu.

We also ordered 2 medium burgers and 1 well done, but all came out medium rare. When we tried to address the issue, the responses were dismissive: “this is how it’s done here” or “for the future, this is a place where it takes forever.”

It’s fine if there are delays or issues, it happens. But tell your customers upfront, not when they’re already seated and committed. Also, making people feel like they can’t ask questions or express concerns is not okay.

If your restaurant often runs into these problems, at least show some accountability or basic customer care. Unfortunately, this experience was frustrating, overpriced, and poorly handled from start to finish.
We ended up paying 50$ per person for a beer in a can and a burger wrongly cooked, without fries and with the side dish we didn’t want.

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road

Thanks!!
Hope to see you again soon!

review_text: Heidi’s is a great neighborhood find! Great food and great service. Always a warm welcome and a fun atmosphere. Cannot wait to go back soon!!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
Heidi's House by the side of the road
Heidi's House by the side of the road
Heidi's House by the side of the road

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text:
Heidi’s House and Ed’s Elbow Room are your quintessential neighborhood restaurant and bar, providing the same great food and different atmospheres, depending on your mood. The food that I’ve had is excellent and what you see coming out of the kitchen going to other tables makes you wish you had a bigger stomach to try it all.

Ed’s Elbow Room features some of the friendliest bartenders that tend to your every need and remind you of what service should really be that is definitely lacking at other restaurants and bars in the area.
owner_response: Thanks so much Jared! Hope to see you soon!!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: Our favorite cozy neighborhood spot! The staff is so kind and the food is absolutely delicious!! I dream about the gnocci and the short rib/shrimp tacos and bruschetta! The shrimp salad is also a favorite.
owner_response: Thanks Zoe.   We appreciate you!! 🍷❤️

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: This place feels like coming home to your favorite cozy spot that always hits just right. I've been here for date nights and catching up w friends- a perfect place for both.  It's such an ideal NYC neighborhood hangout- the food is ALWAYS outstanding, and the ambience (think cool jazz tunes, no tvs) is exactly what I need after a long overstimulated day.
owner_response: Thank you so much Stephanie.  We hope to see you again soon!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: The space was small, and the service was unfriendly and rude. The cramped layout caused people to accidentally turn off the lights repeatedly, and there was no system in place to manage overflow. In winter, opening the door let in cold air, making the entire space—and the food—uncomfortably cold.

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: Heidi's house isn't just a local bar; it's a charming neighborhood gem. The wonderful staff make you feel instantly at home, and while the drinks and food are excellent, it's the warm, welcoming atmosphere and the people that truly keep you coming back. If you're looking for a truly special spot with undeniable charm, Heidi's is a must-visit.
owner_response: Thank you so much Paige.  We can’t wait for you to visit us again soon!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: Favorite local spot

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: First of all, when you're in NYC on the Upper East Side, this is a *must go* spot. Not only is the food excellent, but the staff is exceptional. The owners are locals who embrace their customers and constantly consider their feedback. Perfect atmosphere, and an eclectic menu worth trying. Consider me a regular at this spot!
owner_response: Thank you so much Robert!  We appreciate your kind words.  Hope to see you again soon! 🍷🍷

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: I absolutely love coming here!! Such great service and a cozy ambience. Definitely try the shishito peppers, truffle Mac and cheese, and date pudding- they are sooooo delicious! Best Mac and cheese I’ve ever had!
owner_response:
Thank you so much Grace!
We hope to see you again soon.

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: If you're in search of an unforgettable dining experience in New York City, look no further than Heidi’s House. From the moment you step through the door, you're enveloped in a warm, welcoming ambiance that strikes the perfect balance between cozy and elegant. Our server, Freddie, was so sweet and funny. He is so knowledgeable about the menu and it is apparent that he is passionate about this place. He really made us feel like an old friend. And the food is jaw-dropping. The mac and cheese? Oh. My. God. It’s spectacular. It's not just the best mac and cheese in NYC—it’s hands down the best I’ve ever had, anywhere. I ordered it with jalapeños and you certainly can’t go wrong with a little bit of spice and a whole lot of cheese! This is my favorite spot in the city. It’s unmatched on all levels and I can’t wait to return again and again and again!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text:
The BEST mac & cheese in the neighborhood.
My favorite is with truffle oil.  Pro tip: Order it well done so it's extra crispy!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: Wow! All (chorizo/jalapeño mac and cheese; wok seared shrimp salad; etc) was delicious - but seriously, that meatloaf? “Best of melt in mouth” winner. Date pudding, chocolate soufflé. All outstanding in a small family-run UES treasure.
owner_response: Thanks so much, glad you enjoyed! We can’t wait for you to visit again!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: The food was meh for the price. I heard they wouldn’t give someone hot water.

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: The service was not good. The food was mediocre as well. Would not recommend.
owner_response: Thanks for hurting a small business.

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
owner_response: Thanks Jason!!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: cute spot! good service, food was extremely meh especially for the price. would come back for a drink before a dinner elsewhere

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: Extremely disappointed by this place. I really wanted to like it but each dish was uninspired. The Mac and cheese was doused in nutmeg. To make matters worse, check for two apps, a main and two beers and a glass of wine came out to $160. I really don’t take any pleasure at all in leaving a bad review but thought others should be warned.
owner_response:
I’m sorry you didn’t like the Mac and cheese.  It’s rare for us to hear such feedback.  
In terms of our pricing, we are subject to high food costs and high rent.  I wish it were different
Reviews like these are damaging to small businesses.  I urge you to reconsider. Feel free to email us to remedy your experience.

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
owner_response: Thank you!!

restaurant_name: Heidi's House by the side of the road
review_text: Fantastic food, drinks, and service.
owner_response: Thanks Evan!  Hope to see you again soon!

review_text: Lively
Food is great but on the weekend it is very very very loud. It’s not the restaurant it’s the customers .. don’t understand why everyone is so loud.. 93Db on the scale btw

I love that this place stays open late and still offers their full menu—it’s great to enjoy a tasty, high-quality dinner even at night. So far, I’ve really enjoyed everything I’ve tried. The food is consistently good, and the service is quick and friendly. Its definitely a spot i will keep going back to.

A great Italian restaurant on the Upper East side of Manhattan. Most of us had pasta, which we really enjoyed. I especially enjoyed the gnocchi. There was a nice selection of wines and beers. We would definitely come here again.

UVA is a classic UES spot that never disappoints—perfect for a date night or catching up with a friend.

The food is always reliable. I can never come here without ordering the truffle gnocchi—it’s rich, flavorful, and honestly hard to beat anywhere else. The gorgonzola pear salad was light, refreshing, and very good. The meatballs were just okay—small in size (six per order, good for sharing) with a sauce that tasted more onion-forward than I remember. Not bad, but not a standout.

Service is consistently strong—the food came out quickly, our waitress was attentive, and the whole staff is always accommodating. A neighborhood staple for a reason.
Best food in nyc. Patty, Luigi and Massimo are the best!!
Excellent excellent food incredible service can’t ask for more !!!!

Overpriced. We were given the specials menu, but none of the items on it had prices listed. Both my friend and I ordered the truffle pasta, and when the bill came, we were surprised to see it was $45 per plate - $90 just for the pasta. That’s on me for not asking the price, but they really should have made it clear on the menu.

In total, with one drink each, a shared salad, and the main courses, the bill came to $146 before tip - over $175 with a 20% tip. It's a cute place, but not worth that much money.

Disappointing. The tables are too small and too close together. The chairs are uncomfortable. The room is so loud & crowded you can’t have a conversation. They refuse to bring you bread until after you order your entrée. The appetizers came in four minutes, proving that nothing was made to order. It tasted microwave hot. The oil used for frying was old and bitter. The waitstaff was kind of rude and impatient. The pasta sauce tasted like it was made with  cheap tomato paste. It had that cheap, bitter aftertaste. The duck was so tough that it wasn’t chewable. The menu does a terrible job describing the food that they bring you. Literally nothing about the experience was good or noteworthy. I have no idea why this place is so crowded. There are so many mediocre Italian places on the upper east side. All of them are better than this.

My friend and I were so excited to come to Uva for the first time on a Saturday night. We have both lived on the UES and had never been. So, we were thrilled when we got a reservation for 7:45 on a Saturday! We were greeted by a very friendly host and were seated immediately. Then we met our waitress…who couldn’t have been less friendly…
Her tone and demeanor towards us was unfriendly from the moment she came to take our drink order. Our food took over 40 minutes to come out and after we ordered our appetizers, she did not come to check on us once…while we saw her tending to other tables and saw other tables that arrived after us get their orders before we did, as well as multiple rounds of drinks. By the time our food finally came out, I was starved. It was clear they forgot about us and scrambled to get our food out quickly. The shrimp in my pasta were grey..clearly not fully cooked. My pasta was drastically under-seasoned. Our waitress, again, avoided us. Didn’t come over to ask if we were happy with our food. By the time we had finished eating what we could, we asked for the check before they had even cleared our plates. I don’t know what was going on and I can’t remember the last time I had a BAD meal in NYC…until today. I was beyond disappointed by UVA. A place I have been dying to try for years. It’s safe to say I’ll never be coming back and I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone.
Frozen expresso martini 💜💜💜💜
review_text_translated: Frozen espresso martini 💜💜💜💜

review_text: Delicious Italian food. We went for a birthday celebration and sat on the patio. The vibe was excellent and it felt like a little out of the way place to enjoy good food and conversation.
Uva is always good. Food is super consistent and has been for years. Love it!

I don't know why I haven't left a review before. I have been coming to UVA for a number of years now and consistently the food and service is on point. I truly appreciate that they have cocktail onions for a Gibson. Thank you! I will be returning soon.
Fantastic Pollo meatballs with mushrooms, spaghetti with veal meatballs and vegetarian meatballs.
owner_response: Thank you so much Michael!

review_text: UVA has been around for years, always great food, friendly service and fun atmosphere
owner_response: Thank you Steven, we sure have, 20 years! It's due to our amazing neighbors and locals such as yourself that we are still here today, so thank you for taking the time to leave a review - it means a lot!

review_text:
Good
Nice

Very good food, a bit hot inside. Sunday dinner was very good.  The one thing that stood out was the service. Beyond good, so many choices in the city Uva is an excellent one. Plus Gluten-free options.

The last day of our New York stay we wanted to have real authentic Italian food after our Guggenheim visit.... yes, this place was featured at NHONY but to me that would not matter. Pappardelle and Gnocchi Ricotta were our main dishes after a delicious salad (Bianca) and polpettine. Delicious, full of flavor and obviously using the correct ingredients as we did not feel drowsy afterwards (seems to be an issue with Italian places in our experience - maybe an issue California?). Finished our meal with real gelato and a torta di mandorle (almond tart). Ambiance? The place is quite dark but luckily we were able to sit at the back patio which helped a LOT. Quiet and plenty of daylight, while still easily accessible for the staff. Great place.
owner_response: Thank you so much for such a detailed review Ruud!

review_text: Love this place! The atmosphere is awesome very romantic vibes, dimly lit many candles. There’s also a seating area in the back that has a glass ceiling so the light comes through if you’re more into a sunny atmosphere over a dimly lit one. The food was great I will be back for the pasta & lots of cheese selections!
owner_response: Thank you Taylor, we appreciate you taking the time to write this review and supporting restaurants, we look forward to welcoming you back!

review_text: Great location and ambiance, brought my little one and friends to their "meatball monday" prix fixe which is a great vibe.  Food was very good, reasonably priced, and service was attentive and prompt.
owner_response: Thank you Justin! Your review means a lot to us!

review_text: Very Italian food I've had in New York. The portions are on the smaller side. The gnocchi were full of flavor and a perfect consistency. The pasta my friend ordered was as good. The desserts were not as impressive as the main entree, but still good. The atmosphere is also somewhere between cozy and modern. It gets very busy.
Top class, Service and very good food
owner_response: Thank you so much Alex, this means a lot to us!

review_text: UVA is a cozy, inviting neighborhood gem on the UES, offering delicious Italian cuisine. I always start with the pancetta or soppressata--both are exceptional! The pasta dishes never disappoint, but the standout is the ricotta gnocchi, served in a decadent black truffle and chive sauce--creamy, flavorful, and unforgettable. Another must-try is the melanzane alla parmigiana, a comforting eggplant parmesan reminiscent of lasagna, but lighter and just as satisfying. With its warm ambiance and top-notch food, UVA is the perfect spot for date nights and great vibes!
owner_response: Thank you so much Jamie for this glowing review, this is really impactful and means the world to us, thank you so much for taking the time!

review_text: All the greate! Atmosphere, food, service, all!
owner_response: Thank you so much Anja!

review_text:
Beautiful spot to go for a birthday dinner. Menu is great, me and my friends shared the Ragu Pappardelle , the eggplant lasagna, the pesto pasta , the caprese salad, and the meatballs. Loved that I could order half a portion of a pasta cause I wasn’t feeling like eating too much after the apps, so you have that option. Prices were a bit higher than I expected.

Service was ok. Server made good recommendations and gave a good service overall.
owner_response: Thank you so much Laila and Happy Birthday! We are honored you chose to spend it with us!

review_text: Private dinner in a room I honestly didn’t know about - a beautiful downstairs wine cellar and dining room. Staff were awesome. Cocktails and wine very good. Food excellent. Desserts excellent. We’ve eaten here before but this was special and they did a great job. Kudos.
owner_response: Thank you so much Doug! Glad you got to discover our secret wine room and that it made your special occasion extra special!

review_text: Alex Ferrigan is the best waitress we have ever had ! The food was incredible, the drinks were superb, the environment was elegant and  everyone was polite.
owner_response: So happy to read this Rudy! Reviews like this make the staff glow, so thank you for taking the time to write it!

review_text: Nice Italian place in the neighborhood
One of my favorites Italian restaurants in the UES…..and there are many to choose from!
Had a great time celebrating a birthday here. Attentive service. Food was delicious. Private comfortable setting. Will return
One of the best pasta that I have ever tried

This is the best Italian restaurant in NYC. I’m a second generation Italian and this puts most restaurants to shame. Also affordably priced for the value. This is where my family comes for birthdays, anniversaries. My number one restaurant.

Lusardi’s is a true gem on the Upper East Side — the food is exceptional, from perfectly cooked pastas to fresh, flavorful seafood. The warm, welcoming atmosphere makes it feel like a neighborhood staple, and the management is incredibly friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Whether you’re stopping in for a special occasion or a relaxed dinner, you’ll leave feeling well-fed and genuinely cared for.

Our friend suggested we join him at  Lusardi's for dinner - what a great suggestion. This brother-run restaurant has been in business for 44 years, and they know what they're doing. Seemed like mostly regulars. Great service, food, and ambiance. Nice wine list. Lots of specials to supplement the menu. Everything our group ordered was great including appetizers and desserts. Fair prices. Highly recommended if you're in the Upper East End.
Delicious food and outstanding service overall a great experience I'll definitely be back again

Atmosphere was lively and waiters were attentive enough.

The bill was around ~$240 with 4 drinks, a salad, a soup, 3 pasta dishes, and a chicken dish. The food was very disappointing.

Really good food. Got the arugula pear salad was incredible and so was the spinach and mushroom ravioli and Mediterranean Sea bass. The smooth jazz Muzak or whatever lobby music they play really doesn’t fit the vibe
Friendly staff, but the food was mid (especially considering the nearby alternatives)
Food was good,
This is our go to place for celebrating or just a nice dinner. The food is excellent and the service is top notch. Cacio e Pepe is a must - home made
Great experience! Food was delicious and the staff were extremely attentive. I had a large group for a birthday celebration and everyone truly enjoyed themselves. Thank you!
The best service and food.  A neighborhood gem.

The best! Delicious! Our favorite! We love Lusardi’s and come here not just to eat dinner but to celebrate all of life’s moments. We choose Lusardi’s over every restaurant in NYC. Every time we are welcomed so warmly. We love Luis, our favorite waiter, he is so funny and makes your dinner one to remember. All of the food is amazing but I especially love the grouper and poached pear dessert. Their specials are also always fantastic. Thank you for being a little gem in our big city!
Cannot go wrong on any order.  Excellent Italian food. Wonderful staff and atmosphere.
Very good food, great service, great wine menu.  Enjoyed it.

We were very excited to go to Lusardis, as we read positive reviews.  What a disappointment!  The food is horrible.   The pasta is mushy and without flavor. The appetizers were inedible. The prices are inflated and the atmosphere combines stuffiness with arrogance.  On top of this, the servers were all rude and uncaring.  They all exude a feeling of superiority, while making sure that one feels unwelcome. No one even bothered to check on us, or ask why the meal sat uneaten on our table.
We finally left our uneaten food, paid the bill without discount and found another restaurant that understood customer service.
I am not one to complain about restaurants, but my advice on this one would be to avoid at all costs.

Excellent Italian food that feels like it’s always been here and has never needed to change. Consistently delicious and superb service. Great for a special night out - doesn’t try to be “hip” - is just straight forward and good! Highly recommend the Rigatoni Cipullo, Tortelli In Salsa Tartufata, and the Pollo Tartufato (can you tell we like truffles??). Enjoy!

There are so many amazing Italian restaurants on the UES (L’incontro, Italianissimo, Antonuccis, etc) right now, so don’t make a mistake and waste your money here. This review is late but I went here a while back and as our food was served, a huge cockroach crawled out on the table by my pasta! Instead of the manager apologizing, he simply had the staff remove the dish and thought that would be enough to make up for the ‘issue’. He even said ‘this is NY’…essentially, what do you expect? We were flabbergasted. Needless to say, I will never return. Eat at your own risk…

I believe the front house person and the majority of the staff are Italian, so good starting point.

We had the shrimp and butter beans appetizer, seafood pasta, special of the day which was branzino in white wine sauce. All was well-seasoned and just tasted great. The pistachio tart for dessert was chef kiss.

The staff was attentive without being annoying. Cozy atmosphere. Dimly lit.

I would definitely come back here.
Simply the best! They make everything on-site. The staff and food are excellent! The atmosphere is charming. We go here whenever we are in the city, which never disappoints us.
Excellent food and atmosphere; service great.

Had dinner w some friends, they remembered me from some time ago. Food was great, great drinks and friendly owners and waiter. Age in place was a little older but food was good and enjoyable. Need to replace the chairs as my butt was sore

So tasty Our reviews had over 36 million views this year.  super Great UES Italian that has been here forever.  Loved the meatballs and they had a ton of specials.  All of it was awesome. Especially the pastas.  The desserts were spectacular as well.  Check out the photos to see how great the food was.  She loved artichokes and said hers were divine.  Check out all of our reviews.  If we do not like it we do no review it so all of the ones you see are places that are fantastic.  Follow us if you like.  We had over 7 million views in 2021 and we thank you for that.  We don't get paid, we just love to eat.  Be sure to click on "RobH" at the top of this review to see all of them and to follow us if you like good food and shopping
I found the atmosphere to be  gloomy and the food expensive and mediocre.

Best place in NYC WONDERFULL PEOPLE
WINDERFULL FOOD

This is my favorite restaurant in NYC
The food, the service is fantastic.
I just love this place and recommend it to anyone who asked.
Keep up the great tradition that you have thereon the upper east side.
Love you guys 👍🍸

Don't miss this place. The food was outstanding and the service supreme. Luis, the manager, treated my kids with enormous affection and care. They now speak all the time about wanting to go back there. It was just magnificent. Can't say enough good things about Lusardi's.

Great restaurant, the food is always good and consistent. I highly recommend the endive salad.
The service is excellent starting at the door.
It’s the best restaurant in the city!

If you follow my reviews you know I am tough.  This was a pleasant surprise.  Ok. The waiters were a bit obnoxious BUT the wine, food was great.  The veal martini was very good but could have used more white wine.  The lemon brûlée was unusual and terrific.  This is definitely on my NYfavorite list.  FYI if you don’t want seniors+++dine after 6;30😉

Wonderful place! The restaurant is like a well-oiled machine and has a warm and intimate ambiance. Servers always notice what you need even before you realized it. The dishes are delicious and impeccable — I opted for Linguine All' Ammiraglia, and the seafood was fresh, overflowing my plate.
My friends also praised the food highly. The Tiramisu was delightfully soft and creamy. Kudos for accommodating us during the busy Saturday night rush; however, booking in advance is highly recommended due to the bustling dinner hours.
Delicioso!!!
review_text_translated: Delicious!!!

review_text:
Great date spot. Good mix of folks here and some of the best service in New York.
Get the pistachio tart!!

cozy atmosphere, great wine. appetizers were also good, but pasta dishes were pretty bad. we tried three different pasta dishes and all three were dissapointing to say the least. cacio e pepe was legit terrible.
Great food, great service, great atmosphere.

Showed up early for an 8:00 pm reservation but the maitre'd made us feel very comfortable as we waited. Mushroom soup puree, sole in a prosecco lemon sauce and lamb chops were all on point. Meaning, they were exactly what they were described to be and tasted great. Our waiter was attentive and polite. The atmosphere was very nice as well.
I'll be back!

A great place for classic Italian food, as well as a reliable neighborhood place.  The staff have all been there a long time and they are competent and friendly.  The food is reliable and tasty and the prices are, by NYC standards, moderate.  One of my favorite places in Manhattan - reliable and not pretentious.
Food decent service horrible
This place is a hidden gem on the upper east side. Their food is amazing, they have great drinks as well!
Great UES bar and bar food spot. Fresh and tasty. Awesome wings, fried pickles, sweet potato fries.
I love plug uglies,  tadhh, amanda and Priscilla are amazing bartenders , the service is fast the food is great and the atmosphere for games is the best sports bar in upper East side by far

Funkie looking place

It's like a neighborhood spot
It was a little rowdy for my taste. Not much music. Tight space. More of a sports bar to me. It would definitely be a nice private space.

We love this place. Great if you’re craving some bar food. Everything is really delicious and they let us bring our dog which was a huge plus! Depending on when you go there may or may not be wait, it’s kind of just sit wherever you can get a seat

Excellent tater tots with Old bay seasoning and $14 cocktails.

Trivia on Tuesdays!

Edit: BRING BACK THE HUSHPUPPIES

I am thankfully the new ownership group put in the work to spruce up this old space after taking over for Bar Coastal. They still have the classic wings that are fantastic. The atmosphere is far superior than previous establishments at this location and they are pulling in good crowds especially on sports nights. I frequent this Plug for their wings and sports.

Oh man! This place is a gem in the area.

A lovely space, with the size to allow for a good time, whether it be a first, second, or third location.

Do yourself a favor and make your way to Plug Uglies.
Love their wings
Wings are delish, vibes are high. Great spot to watch sports.

Decided to give it another chance. This place still serves good food and has nice ambiance but the bar service is terrible and the bartenders are grumpy.  No personality with the bartenders. Bad pours and bad personality

***************************

I’m a local and this bar has the worst pours and service. Save your money. Ridiculous. They don’t even try to hide it.  It’s too bad because the food and ambiance is good.
Reminded me of the plug uglies in Gramercy.  Just missing a few things.
Nice ambience, good food and decent choice of drinks
Had a quick beer and the bartender was the sweetest. Warm vibes, great atmosphere, cleanest bathroom I’ve ever seen in my life. Going back later to try the famous wings.

It was late, I wasn’t dressed very well & they let me use the bathroom. Polite bartender, will have to make a visit to grab a bite :)

Edit: went back a few minutes later as I was feeling a tad peckish, kitchen was closed :(.

Great pilsner though.

Will be back to try the food.
From Cali watching the Mets Dodgers... great place bomb wings.
Great place to watch a game - generous portions of food!
Cool spot and very good wings. Rest of the food is just meh imo. A very popular spot, but no sound for nfl games, clubby vibe instead. Something to just keep in mind when going to watch a game.
Amazing experience, great burgers and wings!! Come check this place out!!

We’ve lived nearby for a year and just went. That was a massive mistake.
INSANE food and great service. Great bar.

My bartender Amanda made my experience as great as it could’ve possibly been. She gave great NY beer recommendations (I’m not from the area) and charged my phone for me when it was about to die. Great service, great drinks, great atmosphere, will be back!!
Wings are hella good!!!! Good coastal bar replacement.
Good atmosphere for watching games, good beer. Service could be better.
Good wings. No table service

My favorite bar in the Upper East Side!

The female and male servers are the best! The food, especially the chicken and tots, tastes so good! It's never too busy, and they always play great music! I always come here with my coworkers. Love this place!
Great for watching games and throwing back some beers, not too crazy busy which is nice
The food was cold and did not taste good. The drinks were subpar. There are way better Mexican spots in the neighborhood.
Our favorite Mexican restaurant in UES. Great food, service and reasonable pricing
One of the plates we ordered was cold so the waitress took it off our bill. We have been coming here and eating every now and then the drinks are food are usually really good.
this place is a joke, stay away

Excellent staff!   Had lunch and took advantage of a great special.   The food was well portioned and tasted great.
I always have a good experience when I eat at Calexico.
Easy takeout - executed perfectly!
Ask for Catalina, excellent margs and shots

Some of the nicest food I’ve had in a while. The esquites starter was unbelievable (I would’ve licked the plate if it was socially acceptable) and the surf and turf fajitas were out of this world. The guacamole was so fresh too. I’ve been before and so glad I brought a friend visiting me this time. I had the special hibiscus strawberry frozen margarita which was amazing. The staff were so friendly and their service was fantastic. 11/10 and will definitely be back
Stay away from this restaurant. The food was not fresh and I found hair in my corn. Really disappointing
Loved the baja fish tacos
Went for happy hour on a Friday and after we were seated were told there was no happy hour when it’s advertised online Mon-Fri 4-6.
A delightful spot.  Loved the ambiance.  Exemplary service.  Appreciated all the available hot sauces.  Was also grateful for the heat within the dish itself.
As a Californian this place is pretty great

This place is a joke. The food is good, but the service is horrible. Every time you order online they cancel your order. They claim they are either not delivering in your area or they don’t have any delivery drivers. I’m surprised this place is still open. The service has been dropping for the past year. I give them three more months. Not ordering from them anymore.

Update on 5/22/2025: they are still as bad. Ordered at 8:00 pm. An hour later I still don’t have my delivery. They said my order is a mile and a half away when I live less than a half mile away. How is this lance still open?

Service was fine. Food was horrible. The queso is literally velveeta cheese with chilies in it. Atmosphere is cute but nothing special. There are too many amazing restaurants in NYC to waste your money here. Margarita was horrible.
The best chicken bowl i’ve had in a while—miles better than chipotle. I was pleasantly surprised!
The cali-style burrito is my favorite burrito in the city so far. I love the little candles at the tables, and the people are really nice. 10/10

This place is great, food is consistently delicious with really good portions. We order from here often and their service is great. There was once an item missing from our delivery, and they managed to send it over after the fact with extra chips and guac! The brussels sprouts appetizer is my favorite!

AMMMMAZING!!! The Baja Fish….heavenly!!
Churros!! Omg. I’m gonna swim in that sauce lol. Enjoy!!
Excelente
review_text_translated: Excellent

review_text:
Great Food. Better Margaritas. Chill atmosphere. Shoutout to
Katalina and Daniel for the top notch service. Will definitely come back for the happy hour ! 👍🏾🍹🍸🥂
Enjoyed their black bean taco and duck rolls. A little pricey for the amount you get, but it’s nyc.

Myself and my coworkers visit this UES location at least three times a week. We are always pleasantly  welcomed and greeted by both Alejandra and Tatiana (hope I’m spelling their names correctly). Aside from the amazing food that we enjoy and great drinks, we truly come back and back again mainly because of how pleasantly they treat us. Believe it or not, it’s so rare. So happy to be leaving this review :)

This is my favorite Mexican place in the UES! The food is great and service is super friendly, my favorite dish is the barbacoa quesadilla (also really good as a bowl) and they also have great bruch options.
Quite possibly the best burrito I’ve ever had! The guacamole and fresh lemonade was also excellent. Everything tasted so fresh and it was excellent value for money. Loved it.
Everything 10/10

I would love to leave a review of the food but sadly I didn’t stay long enough to even taste it. I walked in on a cold evening because the place was empty and looked nice. The service? LOWSY! I ordered a drink that tasted like they don’t clean their soda fountain, I also asked a question about a certain dish, the server went to go “ask” and literally never came back to the table. I sat there maybe a total of 36 minutes just waiting with my gross drink, until I decided to leave, in a packed restaurant I would have more grace, in a dining room with only two other tables full? NOT. I went to the bar to pay for my gross drink only then did the waiter hurry over -because they probably thought I would leave without paying. (I’m not a heathen)  I paid and then they turned the device over and had the AUDACITY to ask if I wanted to tip!
(HERE’S A TIP: INSTEAD OF CHATTING WITH YOUR COWORKERS, TEND TO YOUR GUESTS!!!!)
Tex-Mex  with its own touch

They charged me $6 for a small side of rice, which I ordered because there was almost no rice in my bowl order. Food was mediocre being generous, small portions and overpriced. Service was great. First and last time, unfortunately.

Half the portion of what you would get in London and twice the price, but it's definitely the best fish and chips in NYC.  Super crunchy batter and succulent cod.  I wish they had real chips rather than fries but they are still pretty good.  The gravy was the best I've had in the USA and surprisingly it is veggie based.  Not too bad to have once in awhile, but if the portion was normal size, I'd order it much more often.  At least the quality is there though.
owner_response:
Hello there, 
Thank you so much for your thoughtful feedback! We're glad you enjoyed the fish and chips and the gravy. We appreciate your suggestions about portions and chips. We hope to see you back soon to try more of our menu!
Cheers, 
Daniel

review_text:
food is pretty authentic.
Very rustic English pub vibe.

Family friendly with a big back room.
Beer and wine only but have several beers on tab.

Sunday roast is nice but relatively fatty.  Good portion of veggies.

The price is def New York mid-tier considering its rustic and local pub vibe.  Most main course are around ~$30 including fish and chips.  So if you grabbed a beer or get an appetizer to share. Expecting to be over $50 per person.

review_text:
Casual British Breakfast Before the Met Visit

We were looking for a British breakfast spot for our early Saturday morning before heading to the Met Museum, and John’s Wood was definitely on our radar.

We had done our homework beforehand, so we ordered right away.

First up was the Scotch Egg which was egg wrapped in sausage. It was a bit different from what I had in mind, especially the portion size. Overall, it was just okay.

We also tried the Fish Burger and Shepherd’s Pie. The Shepherd’s Pie was simple, authentic, and really enjoyable. The Fish Burger, however, was a bit bland for my taste.

Overall, it was a decent spot. I’d consider coming back to try their Fish & Chips, maybe next time!
owner_response:
Hi Piboon,  
Thank you for your feedback! We’re glad you enjoyed the Shepherd’s Pie, though we’re sorry to hear the Scotch Egg and Fish Burger didn’t meet your expectations. We hope you'll give our fish & chips a try on your next visit!

Cheers, 

Daniel

Your palette won't be disappointed.

review_text: We tried this restaurant for restaurant week and loved it! Our favorite dish was the mushroom zucchini risotto and the zucchini croquettes. We also liked the yogurt chocolate mousse but you definitely need to enjoy the tart flavor of Greek yogurt! The salmon was extremely well cooked and high quality but could’ve been more flavorful. The cabbage and avgolemono were quite lemony. The staff was very friendly and accommodating; they were also attentive but did not rush us in any way.
owner_response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us during restaurant week! It's delightful to know you enjoyed the mushroom zucchini risotto and zucchini croquettes. Your feedback on the salmon’s flavor is very valuable, and we'll certainly keep it in mind. We're glad the friendly and attentive service added to your enjoyable visit, and we hope to welcome you back soon!

We truly appreciate you taking the time to leave us a perfect rating! Knowing you had a wonderful experience at Yefsi Estiatorio makes us incredibly happy. We're excited to welcome you back for another delightful visit soon. Thank you for supporting us!

review_text: Great greek food -- highly recommend!  They also have a great collection of Greek wine, which is a nice touch.  The saganaki, spanakopita, lamb shank and greek paella were all fantastic.
owner_response: Your kind words about our Greek fare and wine collection absolutely warm our hearts! We’re so pleased to know you enjoyed the saganaki, spanakopita, lamb shank, and Greek paella. We truly appreciate your high recommendation and can’t wait to welcome you back for another delicious meal.

review_text: Neighborhood restaurant where the medical personnel dropped by from nearby hospitals. Service was correct. Greek salad was fresh but dressing wasn’t there. Octopus portion was generous and tender but lacked a pesto to complement. Fish dishes were well prepared but lacked seasonings that would have elevated the dishes. We rated the meal as 7/10. No alcohol ordered.
owner_response: Thank you for dining with us and sharing your feedback. We’re glad you enjoyed the Greek salad and the generous portion of octopus. Your comments on the dressing and seasonings are appreciated and will be taken into consideration as we strive to continually enhance our dishes.

review_text: The food was amazing. Best Greek food ever I would recommend going there. The service is on point and the atmosphere is cheerful and fun.
owner_response: We're delighted to hear you enjoyed our Greek cuisine and felt the vibrant atmosphere! Your positive feedback on our service truly inspires us. Thank you for recommending us; we look forward to hosting you again soon!

review_text: Food  as always very taste and fresh  everything. We love the yefsi chips..  This greek cuisine is fantastic❤️💚🤍 I recommend and the staff is wonderful.

I’ve been coming to Yefsi for years. It’s been a while since I’ve been back but decided to take a friend for dinner on a Friday night. The service was great but unfortunately the food has gone really down hill. Especially for the price.

The bread was cold and flavorless. On the chewy side.
The salad portion for two has decreased considerably for two. The mouruli salad is shredded lettuce and feta. Just a very small portion.

I ordered a glass of Sauvignon blanc and I’m pretty sure I was drinking Chardonnay.

The sea bass was a full fish for $42 which I would gladly pay because sea bass is delicious! However, we split it and the entire fish was maaaybe 4oz of meat so we each consumed less than 2oz of protein and it was not fluffy nor flavorful.

A manager came by and asked how everything was. So I told her I was disappointed with the fish and explained why. She did nothing which was surprising. I gave them a chance to offer something but it seems this is what they offer customers.

Just a very unenjoyable meal all around.

I miss the old Kanye I mean yefsi!
owner_response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We are truly sorry to hear about your recent experience at Yefsi. Your comments about the food portions, quality, and the service provided are extremely important to us. We strive to offer a delightful dining experience to all our guests and it seems we fell short during your visit. We will certainly address these concerns with our team to ensure improvements are made. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you better in the future.

review_text: A beautiful day to sit outside, the food is awesome, we have seafood linguine and swordfish with rice. The only star dock off is bc they sweep the floor dust so close to us while we eating.
owner_response: It's great to know you had a delightful day enjoying our seafood dishes! 🍤 We're grateful for your feedback about the sweeping and will address it. We'd love to welcome you back for even more beautiful outdoor dining experiences!
Thank you so much for the 5-star rating! 😊 We're so happy to know you had a pleasant experience with us. We can't wait to welcome you back for another delightful meal!

review_text:
Yummmm. 😊 I had a great evening at @yefsinyc, the best Greek restaurant in the UES!

The food was amazing—totally Greek, totally delicious. I could almost hear the Mediterranean waves and the sounds of fishermen beating octopus on the side of their boats.

But even more amazing at @yefsiestiatorio is the hospitality. In no time, I was sitting with Katerina, the chef, the owner and his wife. I felt like family…

An amazing place, this Yefsi Estiatorio. They don’t just feed you here—they totally take you in.

We order the Avgolemono soup which was bright, delicious and surprisingly light. I also had the mousaka which was delicious, though very hearty if you want something light. I definitely recommend this place.

review_text: Terrible service. Cocktails were overly sweetened. Octopus and zucchini fritters were decent. The lemon soup was so salty and the shrimp Santorini tasted like mushy pasta and overcooked shrimp with ketchup.

Came back several years later and I was disappointed. I feel terrible that I have to write this review but my hope is that they make the necessary changes so they can go back to being one of the best Greek restaurants in NYC. The atmosphere is the same, quite nice. Our server was excellent. The food however was unacceptable. As a Greek, I'm very familiar with our tastes. For starters, the tzatziki sauce was a bland spoonful of yogurt. Though I understand that some people don't like too much garlic, this had close to none. It also lacked the zing of acid which typically comes from a splash of vinegar. Completely tasteless and runny. The zucchini fritters (kolokithokeftedes) were almost completely black on the exterior which tells me that the oil they used to fry them should have been changed a long time before they fried these. The fried calamari was extremely rubbery. The one appetizer that was decent was the octopus. Last but not least, the bread that they started us off with was very stale. This is not the Yefsis I knew and once visited weekly :( Having said all this, because it was several years since I had been here, I looked at the reviews to make sure it was still what it used to be. This is why I was so surprised that the food came the way it came. The photos and the reviews written by others were very positive. Perhaps the chef who is spoken so highly of (I'm sure she must be wonderful) was absent on that Sunday evening?
I ordered delivery. I ordered a couple of dishes and got plenty to eat. Very good. Chicken that came with the Greek salad was bit on the dry side though.

Best chicken and potatoes  I've ever had here!! Food was SO good and fresh. The server was aloof though and not that friendly though and when she check on us when we got our food, we asked her for the drink menu and she never brought it. When we finished our meal we asked her for the dessert menu and she never brought it. I would give this place another shot though because the food was so good and just hope we get a different server
Great octopus and cerviche apps, tasty mains and very friendly staff

First time to try Georgian cuisine, and it left a good impression! Dishes new to us but it felt home. Every dish, esp the mushroom with cheese (forgot what it is), is a bomb!

Other dishes are also great tasting! Each blends well if paired with other dishes. Generous in serving.

The staff? Each one feels family welcoming you in their home. Very hospitable, friendly, and knowledgeable to the dishes. Each can be an ambassador of the cuisine. They explained the dish well, including back story beyond its ingridients.

We really enjoyed!

review_text:
We came after a Lincoln Center jazz concert with diner with the simple intention of grabbing a quick small appetizer just to experience this particular Georgian food location with 4.7 rating. I was pleasantly surprised by the modern atmosphere without a bunch of Georgian ethnic decorations all over the place. The young and great looking staff in plain black looked very sheek, and the older bartender in white created a nice black and white contrast. No logos, no clutter, very clean. We both ordered khinkali, quick and straightforward.

The wait for the dumplings turned into a very long delay. When I asked about the status of order, the waiter told me they take a long time to steam and that the water needs to boil. To me, that is ridiculous. Any professional kitchen should have boiling water ready. Even at home I keep a thermos with boiling water for tea or soup. For a staple dish served all day, this made no sense.

The wait was so long that we ended up having multiple conversations and a bathroom visit for both of us!

I asked the hostess if they had any bread, since many restaurants do that. I felt that the Georgians who pride themselves on being the best host,  would embrace this opportunity. She flatly said no. It is not her job, but still, nobody checked in on us for a long time. Nobody even refilled our water. Later I called over another waiter, very nice young guy,  and he helped us pass time discussing tradition of bread, with explanations about how it is baked and pictures.

The bathroom was actually quite nice, especially for Manhattan, but with a random photograph of two parrots on the wall.
The wait dragged on. My dumplings came out at least ten minutes before my son’s. We usually eat together, so I waited. By the time his food came, my dumplings were predictably cold, and nothing was done about it even after i commented.

Weird: My plate had sour cream, and his plate had a little glass pepper shaker placed right on the plate. That was the most random thing because those shakers are usually sitting on the table next to the salt, not sitting next to your food, touching it.

The vegetarian mushroom dumplings were wonderful, but cold. I also want to note that the prices on the online menu $10 did not match what was presented at the restaurant 12.95.

Afterward they cleared our table completely, even whipped it, but did not bring the bill. Any restaurant knows the check should follow when the last plate leaves. Instead, we sat at an empty wiped table waiting even more, missing a beautiful sunset. I finally asked the redhead waitress for the check and told her it was annoying that my food came ten minutes before my son’s. For a small party of two, entrees should arrive together and hot.

That is when the real fun began. In my attempt to leave after 1+hr, the opposite happened. I was surrounded by the bartender on one side and the redhead on the other, standing within two feet of me. They insisted the meal would be on them and refused to let me leave unsatisfied. The bartender kept saying "i take the blame" even though he never serviced our table,  and switched to speaking Russian, which I did not appreciate in the context of today’s politics. I felt insulted by the switch in language during all of this, as if I had any difficulty explaining myself in English (I do not,  I assure you).

I found it ironic, since earlier we had discussed how free food can be considered insulting in Georgian tradition. Our entire intention was just a quick fifteen minute in and out for a couple of appetizers turned into more than an hour boredom and cold food. My bill was small. I insisted on paying, and it turned into another long back and forth. I even told them I would leave a bad review (hey,  I never said I wouldn't even if they did)  if they did not let me pay.

And in the middle of all that back and forth, I missed the sunset. Totally wasted evening.  we already ate at the jazz club,  but even after all this waiting,  I was ironically starting to feel very hungry again.
I came full,  and left hungry.
owner_response:
Dear Anna,
Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback. We’re glad you enjoyed the atmosphere, but we sincerely apologize for the delays and service issues you experienced.

We always strive to provide every guest with a seamless and high-quality experience, and it’s clear we fell short during your visit. Your comments are very important to us, and we’ll work with our team to improve.

We hope to welcome you back for a smoother experience.

review_text:
My mom and I decided to stop at this Georgian restaurant for something light. We weren’t planning on a big dinner, just a quick taste of the place.
We ordered khinkali dumplings, expecting them to arrive fairly quickly. Instead, we waited. And waited. When my mom and I both asked what was taking so long, but I am used to everything taking longer in Georgian culture.

The wait stretched on long enough that we started running out of patience. My mom asked the hostess if anything like bread was available while we waited.  the restaurant was far from packed. Eventually we waived for another server to stop at our table,  finally

When the dumplings finally started to come, they didn’t arrive together. My mom’s plate showed up first, and mine didn’t come until about 10-15 minutes later. She tried to wait for me, but by the time my food came out, hers had cooled off. This food can't be consumed cold,  the cold dough turns into chewey rubber.

What I received was three dumplings and, oddly, a small glass pepper shaker resting right on the plate next to the food. Not on the table, but literally on the dish itself. It looked random. My mom’s dumplings came with sour cream, which at least made sense.

The lamb dumplings tasted good.

When we finished, the servers cleared the table completely but then left us sitting with nothing. No check appeared. We ended up just staring at an empty table, waiting, while the sun was setting outside. Watching that moment slip away was frustrating. Eventually my mom had to go over and ask for the bill herself, and she mentioned to the server how frustrating it was that the plates hadn’t been timed together and having yo wait for the check

At that point we just wanted to pay and leave, but instead things took an even stranger turn. All of a sudden, the bartender randomly appeared and one of the servers positioned themselves on either side of my mom, like blocking her.  This turned into an uncomfortable back and forth.

The whole thing dragged on far longer than it should have. the staff went in circles. Then, to make things worse, they switched to speaking Russian while addressing my mom.
Very long and strange experience.
Do not recommend.
owner_response:
Thank you for your feedback. 
We’re glad you enjoyed our food but we sincerely apologize for the delays and service issues you experienced. We’ll review this with our team to improve and hope you’ll consider giving us another chance.

review_text:
This little restaurant has caught my eye every time of the many times i have meandered by it. This friday it seemed appropriate to have a closer look. Made the reservation, signed and sealed. I walk in a gesture to the host, reservation. He escorts me to my table. I sit down as though I am some sort of highly respected food critic (one day). He comes over shortly after with a menu, another man drops off a bottle of water.

Eventually I order, I might add at this point that the service throughout my meal had seemed merely transactional, no words were exchanged above what was absolutely necessary. Something that doesn’t necessarily bother me, but something to note. Perhaps it is a Georgian attitude, I know my Armenian grandmother can come off like this at time - that point is related to the extent Georgians and Armenians are similar, which I am not sure. I digress. I order Soko Ketze and the Chakapuli, to be accompanied by a glass of red georgian Kvevri wine. The Soko Ketze was underwhelming, and i partly blame myself in choosing poorly among the options, but it was essentially white button mushrooms that were only slightly cooked and didn’t appear to have much seasoning, then melted georgian cheese on top, the cheese was good but seemed haphazardly put together, both of which sat in a pool of butter. The Chakapuli was great, tender lamb bits nestled amongst some great punchy herbs of tarragon, parsley, mint, and i’m sure others. bread was good too and the wine i very much enjoyed.

Other notes: really cool interior and chinaware.

Would come back to try other dishes.
owner_response: Ethan, thank you for sharing such a detailed review. We’re glad you enjoyed our Georgian food, wine, and the atmosphere, and we truly appreciate your feedback on the Soko Ketze and service. Your comments help us see where we can improve while continuing to offer the best of Georgian cuisine and hospitality. We hope to welcome you back soon to our Georgian restaurant in Manhattan for a meal that fully meets your expectations.

Brian, we are genuinely grateful for your generous five-star review of Oda House,our Georgian restaurant in Manhattan!  Your support is incredibly valuable to us, and we can't wait to welcome you back for another outstanding culinary journey.
