owner_response:

À bientôt et merci encore,  
Gary Wallach

review_text: Omg, can we talk about Johnathan for a sec?! He is seriously the sweetest and made the most perfect lemon drops ever. Like, I’m still dreaming about them—but don’t get us started on his espresso martinis. He was so positive, so fun, and made us feel totally welcomed the whole afternoon. 10/10 would come back just for his vibes and his drinks!
owner_response:

We’re so glad you enjoyed Johnathan’s lemon drops and espresso martinis—he’ll love hearing this. His energy truly makes a difference and we’re happy you felt welcomed. Next time, check out our other spots at Renwicknyc.com.

Thank you for sharing your experience.

review_text: I had an absolutely amazing experience with Johnathan! From the moment we were greeted, his friendliness and positive energy set the tone for the night. He went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect, and honestly, he made the best espresso martinis I’ve ever had—smooth, rich, and crafted with care. Johnathan made the whole experience fun, welcoming, and memorable. Can’t wait to come back for another round!

review_text: Our bartender Jonathan was phenomenal! So energetic and sociable, made the best drinks too!
owner_response:

She was incredibly sweet, walked us through the menu, gave great recommendations, and was just so genuine and kind.
Every single dish we had somehow topped the last. You can really tell how much thought goes into the food here. Nothing felt overly fussy, just really, really good. We’ll definitely be coming back. Can’t recommend it enough.

review_text: Last minute table— they kindly let us walk in as long as we were done within an hour and a half. The Altair five spice cocktail was somehow reminiscent of Apple cider to me though it was not included on the ingredient list. The gnocchi were out of this word, soft and flavorful. My friend had the sweet corn ravioli and she was kind enough to let me try one— as the waitresses warned it was a salty-sweet dish. It reminded me a bit of a pear ravioli I’d had in Florence though the flavor profile was completely different. The sweet corn ravioli had a brown butter taste to the filling that made you want to keep going back for another bite.
owner_response:

We’re glad you enjoyed the Altair five spice cocktail and our gnocchi, and it’s great to hear the sweet corn ravioli left a memorable impression. review_text: Had an absolutely amazing experience last night at this midtown Manhattan Restaurant and Bar. The head bartender (David) is a master mixologist and made us 4 rounds of amazing and beautifully prepared cocktails. I think my favorites were the Roasted Apples and the Smoked Coffer with the desert course. Our server (Kira) was awesome and gave us a thorough review of the menu. The food was wonderful and we experienced all the elements. She was friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. This was  a clear 5-star experience and recommend anyone in the Manhattan area spend a fabulous evening there. We will make this a regular stop every time we visit our daughter in NYC. Chef’s kiss to Altair !!!

Great place would definitely come back.

review_text: Amazing soups and curry, definitely worth the visit
Sono andata a pranzo in questo locale thai, menu vario e sembrava tutto super gustoso! Non frequento da turisti di passaggio (come lo eravamo noi). Conto compreso di mancia 50$. Consigliato!
review_text_translated: I went to this Thai place for lunch. The menu was varied and everything looked delicious! I don't frequent tourists passing through (like we did). The bill, including tip, was $50. Recommended!

review_text:
I’ve been coming here for over 10 years, and it’s still one of my favorite spots. Even after moving away from New York, I make sure to stop by every time I’m in town visiting friends. I’ve never had a dish I didn’t enjoy here—everything is consistently delicious and comforting, like home-cooked food.

On my latest visit, we had the khao kha moo, ba mi poo, and khao soi—all packed with rich, authentic flavors. The restaurant is always busy, which says a lot, but now that you can make reservations in advance, it’s much more convenient.

This place truly never disappoints and remains a must-visit every time I’m back in the city.
owner_response: Thank you so much 😊

review_text: Thai cuisine is in my top 3 favorite cuisines ever. So much so that I've traveled to Bangkok to eat and learn to cook more than 3 times now. While I have my usual Thai restaurant go tos, Pure Thai is now my favorite when it comes to their noodle soups! I've just recently tried both their beef and roasted pork soups with rice noodles and they were so delicious and comforting! They also do their Thai iced tea just right and have good vegetable spring rolls! Service is warm and friendly even if they get so packed and busy. The restroom is spacious and clean especially in their expanded section which we usually enjoy better. Can't wait to come back soon for my Thai noodle soup fix! :)
owner_response: Thank you!

review_text: Super Thai. Un des meilleurs que j'ai testé hors de Thaïlande.
review_text_translated: Super Thai. One of the best I've tried outside of Thailand.
owner_response: Thank you 🙏🏻

review_text: Service and food was outstanding. The Pork Trio special was fantastic. Great place to visit and enjoy great food. Oh and get their lychee martini. Chef's kiss.
Muy buena comida . Lugar muy local , sencillo pero no barato . Vale la pena probar , si andas por el rumbo date una vuelta. El personal es súper amable
review_text_translated: Very good food. A very local place, simple but not cheap. It's worth a try; if you're in the area, stop by. The staff is super friendly.

review_text: Healthier/leas oil than most restaurants! Tastes like home cooking :)

It used to be my go-to spot. Unlike many other Thai restaurants, their unique menu offers an immersive Thai experience.  They’ve always been quick to serve, and it seems their menu has evolved a lot over the past 10 years.

I dined here alone today and ordered the Seafood Pad Cha—it was absolutely delicious! The service was excellent, and the atmosphere is clean, quiet, and peaceful. The restaurant has a strong authentic Thai vibe that makes it feel special. This has definitely become one of my favorite spots in New York.

Nice spot for groups and for alone, they have bar seats so if you want to dine for a quick meal it's good for that too. The beef pad see ew was what I got and it was very flavorful and noodles were perfectly soft and chewy!
owner_response: Thank you :)

review_text: Very flavorful. The seafood was incredible

A little change of colour and style for table setting and decoration inside. Some special dishes and drinks on the menu today so I tried the chicken seafood rice noodle stir-fry and have a glass chrysanthemum flower drink. Always friendly staff!

Still my most favourite Thai restaurant to pop in for a quick lunch or group dinner. Love the noodle bowls the best!

They had daily specials at this time when we visited and it was beautifully cooked braised pork with spiced thin noodles with sauce. I also love the sugarcane ice cream! The staff is always attentive and friendly here 😊
owner_response: Thank you so much

review_text: We tried duck noodle soup, Sukhothai pork noodle soup and boat noodle soup. They were all really yummy. My most favorite was the Sukhothai pork noodle soup.
Enjoyed a solo dinner here. Loved that they have more things than the usual Thai menu. I really enjoyed the seafood soup. Just the right sweet, spicy, and sour.

Ottimo ristorante thailandese, piatti semplici e ben cucinati. Il calamaro grigliato è stato ottimo, grande abbastanza per una cena.
Anche il pad thai preso dai miei amici era molto buono.
Le porzioni in generale sono più che sufficienti per una cena, lo staff è gentile, il proprietario in particolare molto simpatico. Lo raccomando!
review_text_translated:
Excellent Thai restaurant, simple yet well-prepared dishes. The grilled squid was excellent, large enough for dinner.
The pad thai my friends had was also very good.
The portions are generally more than sufficient for dinner, the staff is friendly, and the owner in particular is very nice. I recommend it!

review_text: We came, we sat, we ate, and left all within 15 mins. Came here after a show just before 10pm and they were able to sit us and serve food all within 5 minutes. We gobbled our food and was on our way home in no time. They automatically charged gratuity for our party of 5. The drunken noodle was flavor and had the “wok hay.”
Amazing food,  Good service

Unhelpful, slow, and rude service. I have been there a couple of times and have experienced unpleasant service.

The food is ok.

On one visit, their menu was only digital and required watching an ad before seeing the menu. Hopefully, they have removed this annoyance since.

Do not recommend eating there.

Amazing food! If you are gluten allergic/  intolerant, your options are Pad Thai and Green Curry. I had the Pad Thai was moist and rich, not too sweet. Lycee Martini was so smooth. Definitely recommend!
Fabulous! Our group ordered several dishes to try and share! Miat reserve a table! Must go!
I come to this place every time I'm in the city. Over the years, it consistently delivers great value with delicious dishes and friendly service.

Authentisches, vorzügliches Thai-Food und eine absolut freundliche Bedienung zeichnen dieses gemütliche Restaurant in Manhattan aus. Das mittlere Preisniveau ist absolut angemessen. Wir kommen bei unserem nächsten Besuch in New York sehr gerne wieder.
review_text_translated: Authentic, exquisite Thai food and exceptionally friendly service characterize this cozy restaurant in Manhattan. The mid-range prices are absolutely reasonable. We'd be happy to return on our next visit to New York.

review_text: tight space but sooo worth it for the delicious food. staff were so sweet and lovely!
Affordable food served quickly and hot. Flavors good but curry was a little thin (watery) and Pad See Ew too sweet. Beef in curry was extremely dry.

Un endroit incroyable ! La nourriture excellente ! Le personnel exceptionnel! Que dire d’autre ? À part qu’il faut y aller vite et surtout y retourner ! Un must ! Merci à toute l’équipe ! Quel plaisir en bouche !
review_text_translated: An incredible place! The food is excellent! The staff is exceptional! What else can I say? Except that you have to go there quickly and above all go back! A must! Thanks to the whole team! What a pleasure!

review_text: Great Thai
Amazing food!! Specially the pad Thai
It’s really small tables and chairs but food delicious. One of the best

Pure Thai Cookhouse is a cozy spot with authentic Thai flavors.
Everything was delicious but the chili shrimp was crazy good. Worth going out of your way for.

This place is a must-visit! The noodles are incredibly tasty and the other Thai dishes are just as flavorful. I’ve been here twice already, and both times the food and service were perfect. Special thanks to Khem, who was incredibly kind and attentive, making sure everything was perfect for us. Definitely a 5-star experience!
owner_response: Thank you ka

review_text:
I love this Thai restaurant in New York!🇺🇸 The noodles taste just like home, and the larb kua is exactly like the authentic Thai food 🇹🇭we have back in Thailand. Every staff member is so friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend everyone to come and try it!❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
If you’re craving authentic Thai food in New York, this is THE place to go. Don’t miss it — especially the larb kua!
owner_response: Thank you ka

review_text: The food here is absolutely delicious! The noodles have an authentic Thai flavor, and every single dish is packed with amazing taste — yes, every single one. You can truly experience real Thai cuisine without having to fly to Thailand. The prices are very reasonable, and the staff are attentive and friendly without being overbearing. Highly recommended!

They enforced a 22% tip on our party of five without even asking. I’ve been to many restaurants before, and while larger parties often have tips included, we’re usually informed beforehand and told the tip amount. When I asked, they simply said it’s their policy—basically stealing from tourists.

Autentico, buono, personale discreto e non invadente. Il locale è davvero ben curato e caratteristico
Servizio rapido ed efficiente
Porzioni tipicamente abbondanti come in tutti i ristoranti americani, qualità ottima.
I prezzi sono leggermente alti ma in linea con il resto delle attività
review_text_translated:
Authentic, good, with discreet and unobtrusive staff. The place is truly well-maintained and distinctive.
Fast and efficient service.
Portions are typically generous, as in all American restaurants, and the quality is excellent.
Prices are a little high, but in line with other establishments.
owner_response: Thank you for your feedback!

review_text: Truly authentic Thai flavors, every dish was delicious! The noodles, the appetizer, and the somtum were all spot on. Tastes just like home 🇹🇭💛 Highly recommended!
I had green curry with beef today and had diarrhea afterwards!
Nice food good people here
Great Pad Thai and other noodles. Nice restaurant for occasional dinner.

The food and service were good until they let us leave, even though I was still having my beer. The waitress said, “The table is reserved, and the customers are waiting.” I think that is not right. They should serve the customer who is there first. I get it, you have customers waiting in line, but I paid for the food and drinks, and I was still having my beer. The experience was not very pleasant due to this incident.
Asking for glass of water but not provided 😡
Amazing service
Genuine hospitality!!!!! AUTHENTIC FOOD AND NICEST PEOPLE!!!!

Chalong Southern Thai is incredible! The flavors are bold, authentic, and full of that perfect southern Thai heat. Every dish tastes fresh and made with care — the curry and grilled meats were especially amazing. The staff are friendly and happy to help with recommendations, and the atmosphere is cozy but modern. Easily one of the best Thai restaurants I’ve been to — can’t wait to come back!
owner_response: Thank you so much for your feedback Queen! We can't wait to see you back to our restaurant again too! :D

review_text:
Goat curry was fantastic
Soft shell crab dish was very good but a bit small
Service was excellent and time to get the food was really on point

Overall a great experience would go again
owner_response: Thank you so much for your feedback Ant! It mean a lot to our restaurant to hear you LOVE everything at our restaurant! :D

review_text: Food taste is good, but they are definitely pre-made.
owner_response: We think it might be miss-understanding at some point, Our chef produce her own curries paste and chili paste herself before cooking on each dishes, this is the reason why we would not be able to adjust spicy level which is baes on our chef recipes but it does not mean we have to pre-made the food :D

review_text: This is a very popular restaurant for sure. The food was generally quite tasty. I really liked Pla Tod (fried fish) and See Eew Chicken. For Crab Curry, the curry sauce was very tasty, but it had just a small soft shell crab and it was difficult to find crab meat in the dish - I don’t think it’s worth the price. Gorlae seemed to be a popular appetizer, but I didn’t like it as the meat inside had an unpleasant taste for me.
owner_response: Thank you so much for your feedback Travel! we would take your concerns to improve our service in the future! :D

review_text:
We stopped by just before closing but it was an amazing cuisine in Hell Kitchen.  We are from Toronto so it takes alot of impress with ethnic food but These guys rocked it.

Flavour was exceptional, service truly professional and location was very good.

If I go back to NY ever again this would be one the reasons.
owner_response: Thank you so much for your feedback Shahed! we can't wait to see you guys back to our restaurant again! Have a safe flight back to Toronto!! :D

review_text: Ordered on uber eats because I had an absolutely delicious curry last time. The order was the chicken see-ew and potato dumplings, they are quick to make. I was in a rush but I was assured it would be delivered within 30 minutes. 30 minutes in the order was not even ready to be picked up so I can’t even blame the third party app. I cancelled my order because, again, I was in a rush, but I was still forced to pay the restaurant for their time. Absolutely ridiculous and a waste of my time and money.
owner_response:
We are deeply sorry about what happened to you from your last order, in this case you could call to dispute with Uber Eats and report that you did not received your food on time and then they would refund the penalty fee back to your account.

If Ubers Eats call us and we would help you to confirm that you did not receive your order on time to make them refund the penalty fee back to you.

we would take your concerns to improve our service immediately.

review_text: If you want truly great Thai food, you probably shouldn't be in Manhattan. But if you are, and insist on staying, then this is one of a couple of places—and maybe the best—that earn Hell's Kitchen a very respectable runner-up spot to Elmhurst. One rung up in pricing from the more local-facing places the latter neighborhood specializes in, in this case you absolutely get what you pay for (namely: exquisitely presented and perfectly balanced southern Thai food in a date-night-appropriate setting). Get the yellow curry with softshell crab.
owner_response: Thank you so much for your feedback M! it mean a lot to our restaurant! :D

review_text: Food is very good, sophisticated take on Thai food (shrimp in coconut cream pasta and squid ink fried rice highly recommended; crab curry was disappointing after the hype).  Cocktails are creative and delicious.  Noise level is so painful (can't hear across the table) I'm not sure I'd go back.
owner_response: Thank you so much for your feedback Steven! we are so sorry if our crab curry didn't reach your expectation and noise level were too loud for your party! we would take your concerns to improve our service in the future shortly! :D

review_text:
Worst Thai food I’ve had in NYC. Portions were tiny — two people, three dishes and a dessert, all finished because it was too pricey to waste.
$29 crab curry had half a soft-shell crab. Server said, “That’s how it always is.”
$33 steamed fish was just a small piece, not even palm-sized, and salty.
Goat curry was dry and way too salty.
Paid $142 with tip. I’ve tried tons of Thai spots in NYC — flavors here are average at best, and the portions make it a terrible deal. Definitely not worth it, especially for group meals.
owner_response:
Thank you for your feedback Nabules, due to we use fresh seafoods, homemade curries pastes and homemade chilies paste in-house with no cans product at the restaurant so this might be the reason why it might hurt your wallet.

Your server has been explained that our restaurant portioned  everything to make sure everyone would get the same quality and the same portion on every single dishes Ex. Steamed fish we portion it 160g. And steamed fish’s sauce is base on chilies and limes so we are not sure how salty you got from our steamed fish, if it our steamed fish or other dishes make you feel salty we have to apologize about that but in this case if you feel something wrong with your order so please don’t be hesitate to let our manager know to resolve your issue.

We are so sorry about your inconvenience. :D

review_text:
Great spot for southern Thai food (which is seafood focused). Service was spot on. The delicious food was prepared with care. Just note this is not your typical Thai menu.

Drinks were awesome too. The Thai iced tea with lychee sounded simple but was one of the best non-alcoholic drinks I’ve had! The waiter told us the key was they use fresh lychee juice they press at the restaurant.

I think that focus on delivering delicious homemade food is why the place shines. Can’t wait to go back.

The lumpu salad with scallop, moo ko, and fried fish were definitely standouts but everything else was also incredible. Service was great our entire meal and made us feel well served even in a packed restaurant. I don’t know how I haven’t tried this place sooner.

review_text: Chalong was absolutely lovely. My brother and I were able to score a table in less than 30 minutes without a reservation on a busy Saturday night. The drinks were nuanced and the seafood was absolutely top-notch. I got the whole fried fish and my brother got the Chilean sea bass - both were standouts. His was perfectly cooked in a delicious sauce, mine was an incredibly fresh Branzino, deboned (skin-on) with an addicting sweet and sour broth. Both came with reasonably well-cooked rice. I also have to say the service was incredible and on par with the food. Would love to return should I be so lucky!
owner_response: Thank you so much for your feedback Collin! It mean a lot to our restaurant and we can't wait to see you guys back to our restaurant again! :D

review_text:
Dined here last night. The food was good, but we won’t be returning.
We arrived on time for our reservation and were greeted not with a hello or welcome, but with, “You only have your table for ninety minutes.” That set the tone for the evening.
The atmosphere is chaotic, and the noise level is overwhelming. Tables are packed so closely together—maybe six inches apart—that it feels like you're dining with strangers at your elbows.
Service is rushed, and the pace of the meal feels more like a timed drill than a relaxed night out. The whole experience seems designed to turn over as many tables as possible, as quickly as possible.
In a city like Manhattan, with so many great dining options, there’s no reason to subject yourself to this kind of experience. Good food alone just isn’t enough here.
owner_response:
We have to apologized about our hostess's tone since english language isn't their first tongue as well as the music might too loud to catch the words, this might effected to our hostress's voice to speak louder to your party but we didn't mean something in negative.

And we have to apologize about the space between the table to make you feel uncomfortable and service that make you feeling rush.

In this case if you feel something wrong to our service, table's space, feeling rush or food's taste PLEASE don't be hesitate to let our manager know to resolve those issues to make you feel satisfy at our restaurant because our customer would be our first priority at our restaurant.

we are so sorry about your inconvenience.

review_text: I cannot say enough good things about this place. Food, service, atmosphere. Dreaming about the food until I go back
owner_response: Thank you so much for your feedback Samantha! We can't wait to see you guys back to our restaurant again! :D

review_text: My experience at this restaurant was genuinely so disappointing from start to finish. We arrived for our 7:30PM reservation and were told to wait outside for a few minutes while they prepped our table, only to wait outside for close to 30 minutes before we finally went back inside to remind them we were still waiting, sitting down around 8PM. Then, they refused to accommodate a member of our party who had an allium allergy - claiming that the chef only wishes to serve dishes authentically and not modify them - so our request to sub-in a simple soy sauce for the existing sauce in a noodle dish was denied. They went so far as to let us know that the manager said it was okay for us to bring in food from outside, at another restaurant, and eat it at the table, instead of trying to make a slightly modified dish to accommodate the allergy. Then to top it all off, they gave us a "free" appetizer during the meal to apologize for our wait. That would be great had we not gotten the bill and the "free" appetizer we didn't order was listed as a line item, $17, but they deducted a cheaper appetizer (costing $15) off our check instead. So in effect, we paid $2 for an appetizer we never asked for. Truly such a poor experience, and we had high hopes for the restaurant. Warning to all who have food allergies - do not expect the restaurant to do anything to try and help you.
owner_response:
We are so sorry about what happened to you from your last visit, we would not be able to accommodate your restriction due to our chef would represent her recipes and bring authenticity from her hometown to our restaurant and our manager decided to allowed you to get a food from outside to our restaurant to enjoy with the rest of your party.

what we thought it might be the best solution for you at the time so if this solution didn't resolve your issue we have to do apologize about that.

review_text: We got so lucky on our first night in NYC! Found this place on Google Maps while we were walking around Hell's Kitchen and called ahead - got a table for five at 8pm on a Friday night in June! Not only was the food delicious and filling in that inimitable Thai fashion, but the New York vibe was in full effect with what felt like a cross-section of the world dining at the tables around us. Can't do much better than going straight from La Guardia to a spot like this.

review_text_translated: It's a great place to enjoy some Mexican flavors. Their menu changes with the seasons, which makes it appealing. Their guacamole and salsa with chips are delicious. review_text: Preso un tris di guacamole da condividere, decisamente molto buona; buoni anche i tacos e le empanadas, discreta la birra. Il servizio è stato troppo veloce, ci è stato servito tutto insieme subun tavolino troppo piccolo per contenere il tutto.
review_text_translated: We had a trio of guacamole to share, which was definitely very good; the tacos and empanadas were also good, and the beer was decent. The service was too fast; everything was served at once at a table too small to accommodate everything.

review_text: Great margaritas

review_text: Añejo NYC is one of my absolute favorite spots in the city. The atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, the service is outstanding, and the food is incredible. The tacos are full of flavor, the guacamole is fresh and delicious, and the margaritas are some of the best I have ever had. Everything came out quickly, and the staff made sure we were taken care of the entire time. Whether you are here for brunch, dinner, or just drinks with friends, you are guaranteed to have a great time. I cannot wait to come back!

A little pretentious for the neighborhood and food quality isn't what it once was. Still good but not amazing. There is a lack of balance in the dishes, specifically the ceviche, which hides things behind the avocado and salsa rather than focusing on the octopus.
Appetizer was excellent , also main course.
Wonderful place. Awesome food. Enjoyed the cocktails as well. The price is reasonable for Manhattan.
Everything is amazing

Delicious food & a good variety option for vegetarians.

Excelente lugar, la atención del personal insuperable y las recomendaciones de la comida, simplemente ideales, sin duda visita obligada.
review_text_translated: Excellent place, the staff's attention was unbeatable, and the food recommendations were simply ideal. Definitely a must-visit.

review_text: Comida increíble y servicio excelente. Nos explicaron toda la carta y nos hicieron recomendaciones adaptadas al grupo. Todo buenísimo!! El personal muy servicial y profesional.

review_text: Great and friendly service. Good ceviche selection and reasonably priced.
Delicious margaritas (I had the mezcal), superb guacamole and salsas, the enchiladas Verde were fantastic, but the brussel sprouts were the dinner winner. Fantastic! Eat here anytime you can.

Last night me and my husband went to Añejo. I am going to start by saying that the atmosphere is very nice! Our server Edward was very friendly and attentive. We asked him for some recommendations and everything was spot on. Food was delicious!! My husband had a tequila/mescal old fashioned and it was amazing! The guacamole, ceviche and the Carne Arrachera is to die for.
Definitely a place to go back.

Food was really good, the staff did a killer job, and the environment was classicly New York with great people watching.

First rate fish tacos!
Great place for Mexican cuisine. Had the crispy fish tacos. Nice taste and flavor.

Great service, great food and loved the margaritas. I’m very hard to please when it comes to margaritas but they were delicious here, clearly made with fresh squeezed lime and not too sweet. It was LOUD inside, I would recommend some noise-canceling acoustic panels for the ceiling. You never see them and they make a huge difference. Other than that, everything was fantastic and I’d happily come back.
Delicious tacos!

Took a start for service because the restaurant was empty, yet the hostess decided that the only available seats were at the bar. We spent about 1.5 hrs and by the time we left, the tables were still empty.

Bar service was great so boo to the hostess!

review_text:
I was really looking forward to dining here, but unfortunately, my experience was completely ruined by the staff’s constant reminders about the two-hour seating limit. From the moment we sat down, we were interrupted every 20–30 minutes by someone—either the manager or a waitress—telling us how much time we had left. It felt like we were being pushed out the door before we even had the chance to enjoy our meal.

Instead of relaxing and enjoying our food, we spent the evening feeling rushed and uncomfortable. Even when we were still eating, they came again to remind us that our time was almost up. It was very disrespectful and took away from what should have been a pleasant dining experience.

If a restaurant sets a time limit, that’s understandable—but constantly interrupting guests and making them feel unwelcome is not acceptable. Good service is about hospitality and respect, and unfortunately, that was completely missing here.
owner_response:
Hi Nino,

Thank you for your feedback. If you don't mind, could you please share more details regarding your experience with us? It would be greatly appreciated as we could utilize it to improve our service.

review_text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
I had such a great experience here! The food was absolutely delicious — every dish was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The drinks were just as impressive, with creative options and perfect balance. The service really stood out as well — attentive, friendly, and professional without being overwhelming. Overall, it was the perfect combination of great food, amazing drinks, and excellent service. Highly recommend this spot!
owner_response:
Hi Jennet, 

Thank you for the lovely feedback! We are so pleased to know you had such a fantastic experience with us here at KYMA Hudson. Your kind words regarding our food, drinks, as well as service are greatly appreciated as we strive with great effort to provide our guests with only the highest quality in their experience with us. If you ever have any questions or would like to book a reservation, please do not hesitate to reach out to our team. We'd love to have you back soon. Cheers!

review_text:
If you’re looking for a spot to celebrate a special occasion, this place is worth considering. I booked a party of 15 for a birthday celebration and the team was accommodating and responsive. For groups of 8 or more they offer a pre-fixe menu. The portions were generous, and we even took some food home. The salmon and steak were both excellent. Our servers did a wonderful job handling our (slightly needy!) group with patience and made sure the night was memorable.

I’m giving 4 stars because I was expecting the same high-energy vibe as their Flatiron branch, and our table was all the way in the back. If you book a large group, I recommend requesting a table in the middle or closer to the DJ booth for a livelier experience. Overall, we had a great night!

The avgolemono soup has a nice kick of dill, the chicken kebab was cooked perfectly with a nice char, and their French fries are thick cut amd seasoned well.  The atmosphere is nice and the staff is super tentative.   You have to wash down your food with Ouzo.

Useless management. Made a reservation for Sunday at 8:30 pm on Resy; at 8 pm received an automated email that it was canceled. Called to follow up and the phone agent had no beside manner and did not handle it appropriately. She said that the kitchen closes at 8:30 so we couldn’t be accommodated. When we pressed her on why a reservation would be available on Resy, she denied that anything was available for 8:30 pm which was obviously a lie/attempt to evade. When we expressed surprise that no one had called us to discuss, she said that the automated email we received should have been enough. Many people do not watch their email as hawkishly as I do and would have shown up. She said we should come back another time, but there’s absolutely no chance of that.
Amazing night. Great fun! Great service! Will come back and recommend to anyone!

Wow! We walked into a really pretty place! It wasn’t busy as we there very early before heading to a matinee. It’s a great menu and the food was good and substantial! We had to take some food home. Very affordable prices made it all worthwhile to go back again. 👍

First time at this location. Had reservation for brunch   we came on time but the lady at reservation desk was on the phone and no one seated us right away   she did apologize though.  The service otherwise was tops and the food delicious   if we didn't have reservation we would have walked out since the lady at the front kept us waiting and no one else stepped up   it was early   noon reservation.
Really rude manager

awful service  , food is horrible , management is disrectpful i do not recomendd not coming back

Horrible management. The male manager was so rude and belittling when dealing with an issue that was caused on their end. Will charge your card for more than told and will not refund due to "wanting money." Very disappointing.

I don’t even want to give one star this restaurant.  I called to have a shot ordered to my friend for her birthday as I was not there, I specifically said ONE tequila shot to my friend.

A week later I was with said friends and they told me they got a whole round and weren’t charged for it and I was like maybe you guys got shots for free until I looked at my card charge and noticed Kyma charged me $200 for a full round of shots.

I called to speak with the manager who told me that they don’t do one singular shot and that I should know that. I explained that the hostesses NEVER flagged to me that one shot couldn’t be sent. I am on a NYC budget, had I have been told it needed to be a full round I would have NEVER said yes.

The manager blamed me rather then his hostess who didn’t provide all info or a total amount and told me i’m too young to understand how these things work. He was extremely disrespectful, hanging up on me multiple times throughout the call and not listening to me explain what had occurred. I’m so in shock by how unprofessional he was.

Thankfully I can dispute this unauthorized charge. Next time he should tell his hostesses the rules to share with all customers rather then belittling me and telling me I should know better on how this works.

HORRIBLE MANAGMENT

review_text:
Absolutely delicious food! I had the Korean wings and as a Korean foodie who has been to South Korea multiple times, I can tell you, this is as authentic Korean wings you can get from an American restaurant. Super delicious and authentic!
I also had the roasted salmon dish. Also super good and didn’t leave any crumbs…like at all.

Not to mention the staff is fabulous. I was welcomed by the restaurant manager, Uma who was super friendly and mentioned how he liked my name, something I rarely hear. We also had a short conversation about the meaning of my name. Then I had the absolute honor of being served by Mahayla. Her energy was infectious in the most beautiful way, not to mention very funny.

If yall are ever choosing between places to go to, definitely go to this one for good food & good vibes all around!
owner_response: Kadeem, thank you for your wonderful review! We're delighted to hear you thoroughly enjoyed our authentic Korean wings and farm-fresh roasted salmon. Our team takes great pride in crafting delicious, high-quality dishes using the finest ingredients. It brings us joy to know we were able to provide you with an excellent dining experience. Uma and Mahayla will be glad to learn that their friendly service left such a positive impression. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon for more good food and good vibes!

For dinner I had the braised short ribs with garlic mash, spinach & carrots. The meat was so tender braising juice waa tasty & the mash was so good. They also have great cocktails & happy hour every day. I definitely plan on coming back I highly recommend this place food was amazing, atmosphere is chill & the staff is great & for the city prices were right.

review_text:
This place has a unique setup — a Mexican restaurant in the front and a Greek restaurant tucked away in the back. The contrast is pretty clear: the Mexican side is always lively and nearly full, while the Greek side tends to sit quiet and empty.

We went for the Mexican food, and it did not disappoint. Every dish was flavorful, well-prepared, and had that authentic touch that makes you want to come back. The team running the place is warm, welcoming, and genuinely friendly, which adds a lot to the experience.

While the Greek side might not get much love, the Mexican kitchen is clearly the star here. Definitely worth a visit if you’re in the mood for great Mexican flavors in a casual, bustling atmosphere.

-Nizuc Team

Wonderful experience! Best Mexican food in the city 🔥

Stylish Setting, Uneven Execution

Nizuc in Hudson Yards sets the stage with a modern-Mexican aesthetic—sleek lines, an ample bar buzzing with happy-hour energy, and a menu that promises elevated takes on familiar fare. Unfortunately, what lands at the table doesn’t always match the promise.

We began with guacamole and roasted salsa macha alongside tortilla chips. The chips were plentiful, but the guac felt skimpy for the price. The ceviche, served in a coconut milk base, leaned watery and lacked the bright acidity and balance that typically make the dish shine. It felt heavy rather than refreshing, which was disappointing for a starter meant to whet the appetite.

Mains were a mixed bag. The steak arrived aggressively over-seasoned, while both chicken and shrimp fajitas lacked seasoning altogether, leaving them flat. The accompanying tortillas were far too oily, and the chicken mole was simply serviceable without any standout complexity. At $270 for four, the bill aligned with Hudson Yards expectations but didn’t feel justified for the quality.

Service, while polite, was inconsistent—water refills required reminders, the server had to repeatedly check back with the kitchen about dishes, and plates were cleared too eagerly, creating an undercurrent of being rushed toward the check.

Nizuc nails the ambiance and delivers on style, but for now, it feels more like a spot for cocktails and scene than for a meal worth savoring.

#HudsonYardsDining #ModernMexican #NYCFoodReview #NotQuiteWorthIt
Delicious food and cocktails.

If I could give Nizuc an even higher rating I would! Everything is truly incredible here, from the food, ambiance, and the statff! Try the steak and branzino—best I have ever had! I was diagnosed with cancer last year and before my surgery, my wife and I came here to have one amazing meal before i went into the major surgery. The manager, Stephanie, sensed that we were there for something and asked us. We shared my cancer journey and she was so kind, attentive, and caring—she told us to come back once I was in remission. A year later, I made it to remission and my wife called Stephanie to tell her the incredible news and that we would love to do a dinner for our family to celebrate at Nizuc. Even though she wasnt working that day, the entire staff, managers, EVERYONE celebrated us and gave us the true dinner of our lives. In such a sad journey, Nizuc lightened up our lives and we are so grateful that there are people like Stephanie and the staff who can make an impact like this. We will always remember this and will be back often!
owner_response:
Pablo-Andres, thank you so much for sharing your heartfelt story and for your incredible review. It warms our hearts to know that Stephanie and our team could provide you with a memorable experience during your journey. We look forward to welcoming you and your family back to Nizuc for many more celebrations. 

-Nizuc Team

review_text: Amazing modern Mexican food. Great service.  I'll see you again

I had a truly disappointing experience at Nizuc Restaurant due to the customer service. When I first arrived, I was told I could not sit outside because it was “only for dinner,” without even asking if I would be dining or not. Two different staff members received me without any manners, which already gave me a bad impression.

After finally being seated, a third staff member came over and rudely told me I was sitting in the wrong place. I explained that I was placed there by their own team, but instead of handling the situation politely, she spoke to me from a distance and made me move myself to another table. I had to carry the menu on my own and relocate without any assistance.

Only later did another staff member arrive who was finally helpful and attentive unfortunately, this was after the whole negative experience.

The food itself was excellent, but the service was absolutely below the standard I would expect from a restaurant of this level. Management really needs to train the staff in basic hospitality and courtesy.

Edwin, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We sincerely apologize for the disappointing service you encountered during your visit. We are committed to providing a high standard of hospitality. Your feedback is invaluable, and we will address these issues. We hope to have you back for a better experience.

-Nizuc Team

Wow! I’ve tried a few other Mexican restaurants in Manhattan recently, but this one is still my favorite!

I ordered the shrimp taco and fish taco again—just like last time. If you can’t eat too much, I’d especially recommend the shrimp taco—it’s absolutely delicious!😋

Today was even more fun because it happened to be Tuesday. When I got to the door, I realized they have Taco Tuesday deals:
•	A ribeye taco (with a slice of thin steak) for just $5
•	A shrimp taco for $4.50—cheaper than some food trucks!
And the best part? They’re super tasty!

(Regular price for beef tacos is $20 for two, so Tuesday is half-price!)

The dessert tiramizuc is homemade and also amazing, and the atmosphere is great. Draft beer, cocktails, and guacamole are all worth trying. 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

Tip: On Tuesdays, you need to sit at the bar or high-top tables to get the half-price deal!

review_text:
Nizuc isn’t just a restaurant  it’s a full sensory experience. The space is stunning: lush greenery, artful details, and music that sets the perfect mood without being too loud.

The menu is a celebration of bold, modern Mexican flavors. From the creamy guacamole with house-made chips to the slow-braised birria tacos, everything tasted fresh and carefully crafted. I also loved how the dishes were served ,presentation was beautiful but not overdone.

The drinks were just as memorable. Their signature cocktails blend mezcal, tequila, and tropical flavors in unexpected ways . I had a passion caliente that I’m still dreaming about.

And honestly, the staff made the night. Warm smiles, great recommendations, and the kind of service that makes you want to come back.
owner_response:
Hi Tasia, thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your experience at Nizuc. We're especially glad that our team made your night memorable with their service. We look forward to welcoming you back for more unforgettable experiences.

review_text: I came here for work happy hour and an amazing time. The drinks were very tasty. I'm not the biggest fan of frozen drinks by the app plenty of them including a lychee one which was cute. The margarita and mezcal drinks were very tasty. The starter show Food Wise was there pork belly. It was so delicious crispy flavorful and I would go back just for that. The nachos were just okay. You also got the fried jalapenos. Now the star of the show was the guacamole which you cannot pass on. Perfect combination of flavors and you can tell they put some effort to perfecting their guacamole.

My new favorite Japanese restaurant in Hudson Yards area, also whole of Manhattan!

Food recommended were crispy rice for hot appetizer and yellowtail jalapeño for cold. Paired so well with house sake carafe!!!

Sushi and sashimi deluxe, soyu ramen (will try tonkotsu next time) nice umame with mushroom slight flared up taste even with chicken.

Topped them all was Kiki (sorry if I botched the spelling of your name) very caring and attentive.

Food is relatively fast. Plenty of bar seats after work gyoza, Asahi and ramen affordable as well as numbered rolls.

Crowd keeps on rolling in at 8-9pm. So, reservation recommended. Such a nice vista both from inside and outside.

Pricing is reasonable not crazy. $9 beer, quality entree in $20 range as well. Possibly partly why +4.5 rating holds up while some other Japanese restaurant nearby can't.

Gam sa ham ni da.

어느 적당한 금요일 저녁때 예약하고 방문했습니다. 이 지역에 딱히 갈일은 없었지만, 산책삼아 베슬을 갔다가 방문했습니다. 전시장도 주변에 있지만 베슬에서도 그닥 멀지 않았습니다.
.
아이들과 함께 방문했는데, 돈가스가 없어서 아쉬웠지만 가라아게가 있어서 아쉬움을 달랠수 있었습니다. 롤도 하나 주문했고 우나기동도 주문했습니다. 이 두개는 완벽했습니다. 라멘은 미소라멘과 탄탄멘을 주문했는데 탄탄멘이 다른 종류가 나와서 아쉬웠습니다. 그래도 그냥 먹었습니다.
.
하지만 이 집의 특기가 라멘인 만큼 면발이 쫄깃하고 국물이 진해서 정말 좋았습니다. 롤이나 우나기동은 일본식이 아니라 미국에 잘 적응한 느낌이 더 강합니다. 삿뽀로도 병맥주로 팔고 있어서 좋았습니다. 교자도 생각보다 괜찮았고 가라아게도 평균이상은 했습니다. 시간이 되면 재방문할 의사가 있는 맛집입니다.
review_text_translated:
I made a reservation and visited on a pleasant Friday evening. I didn't have anything special to do in the area, but I stopped by after a walk to Vessel. The exhibition hall is nearby, but it wasn't too far from Vessel.

I visited with my kids, and while I was disappointed they didn't have tonkatsu, they did have karaage, which made up for it. I ordered a roll and an unagi-don (uncooked unagi), both of which were perfect. I ordered miso ramen and tantanmen (spicy tantanmen), but was disappointed that they served two different tantanmen. Still, I ate it anyway.

However, as this restaurant specializes in ramen, the noodles were chewy and the broth was rich, which was really good. The rolls and unagi-don felt more like American fare than Japanese. I was also happy that they also serve Sapporo beer in bottles. The gyoza were better than I expected, and the karaage was above average. This is a restaurant I'd definitely visit again when I have the time.

If you are a fan of Ramen, This is a great place, and I highly recommend this Store of food. 5/5.

8-24-25 Update:
Had their Unagi Don (Eel dish), the flavors were quite Honestly Perfect. 5-7 Minute Order To Arrive Service. Still 5 Stars.

review_text:
For a quick, late lunch, I stopped by Suram for some ramen. The establishment on a Friday at 2:30 pm was full (due to activities at the Javits Convention Center). Luckily, some tables cleared up and I received a seat for my party of 2 w/in 10 minutes.

I ordered the Kuro shio ramen ($19), made with chicken stock, chicken chashu, egg, mushroom, naruto (fish cake), scallion, edamame, and bamboo shoots. The portion size itself seemed on the delicate, lighter side. The chicken stock with the roasted shiitake mushroom tasted overbearingly mushroomy. The noodles seemed like the usual Sun Noodle brand or similar.

Audaciously, the establishment calls, what in any other setting would be rotisserie chicken breast slices, chicken "chashu".
owner_response: Justin, thank you for your feedback on our ramen. We're sorry to hear that the chicken stock with roasted shiitake mushrooms didn't meet your expectations. Our chefs put a lot of care into preparing our ramen broths, but we understand that personal tastes can vary. We appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts on our chicken chashu as well. Please feel free to reach out to us at info@suramnyc.com if you have any other concerns. We hope you'll give us another try in the future, and we're always happy to recommend dishes that may better suit your preferences.

It's wonderful to know that our sushi, sashimi, and ramen dishes were able to provide such an enjoyable dining experience. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon for another memorable meal.
Thank you for your rating! We truly appreciate your support and can't wait to have you back soon!

review_text:
A Solid Spot for a Quick Bite

Suram NYC in Hell’s Kitchen is a no-fuss sushi and ramen spot that delivers exactly what you expect. We stopped in for a quick dinner and kicked things off with a couple of sushi rolls—fresh, straightforward, and just right for an appetizer.

For mains, we each went with ramen built on their creamy twelve-hour chicken stock, topped with chicken chashu, egg, mushroom, naruto, scallion, and edamame. The broth was rich enough to satisfy but not something that lingers in your memory—comforting, though not particularly standout.

The restaurant itself has a clean, minimalist look, with a vibe that leans toward Japanese-style dining but softened with an American twist. Service was polite, a little brisk, and seemed intent on keeping the evening moving along. Prices felt fair and very much in line with what you’d expect for this type of casual NYC spot.

All in all, Suram NYC is a decent choice when you’re in the neighborhood and craving sushi and ramen. It won’t blow you away, but it hits the mark for a reliable, uncomplicated meal.

#HellskitchenEats #NYCRamen #SushiAndRamen #QuickBitesNYC
owner_response: Thank you for visiting Suram NYC, Alejandro! We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your sushi rolls and our creamy twelve-hour chicken broth ramen. It's wonderful that you found our restaurant to be a reliable choice for sushi and ramen in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood. We appreciate your feedback on the clean, minimalist vibe and polite service. We strive to provide our guests with a comfortable and efficient dining experience. Please join us again soon for another satisfying meal!
Thank you for your rating! We truly appreciate your support and can't wait to have you back soon!

owner_response: Sam, we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. We're delighted to hear that you and your sons enjoyed the tasty food, quick service, and overall dining experience. Thank you for your kind words, and we look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

review_text: Quality food with a great atmosphere. Staff was super friendly and I’ll definitely have to come back!
owner_response: Vishal, we're glad that you enjoyed the quality food and wonderful atmosphere at our restaurant. It's a pleasure to hear that our friendly staff made your experience even more delightful. We look forward to welcoming you back soon for another

review_text: Excellent food in a relaxing atmosphere 😊
owner_response: Alexandre, we're delighted to hear you enjoyed your dining experience! Our team strives to provide a warm, inviting atmosphere where guests can savor our authentic sushi, sashimi, and ramen dishes. We appreciate your kind words and look forward to welcoming you back soon.
Thank you for your great rating! We truly appreciate your support and can't wait to have you back soon!
Thank you for your great rating! We truly appreciate your support and can't wait to have you back soon!

review_text: Enjoyed the crispy, crunchy rice very much

owner_response: Weizhen, thank you for your kind review! We're delighted to hear you enjoyed our delicious sushi and sashimi, as well as the welcoming ambiance we strive to create. We look forward to serving you again soon!

review_text:
This is the best one during our trip in NYC.
After the High Line tour, we easily found this restaurant for the lunch.
Surprised to discover that the food is so good, even better with the the kindness and the smiles of the waitress.
Highly recommend!

It's our pleasure to provide not only delicious sushi, sashimi, and ramen dishes but also exceptional service to our customers. We hope you'll join us again the next time you're in New York City.

review_text: While visiting NYC for a conference, I decided to pop in and try Ramen for the first time. Of course we have all had the microwavable Ramen, however I have never had it authentic. I was pleasantly surprised. If I am ever back in NYC, I will stop there again.
owner_response: Joe, we're delighted you decided to try authentic ramen during your visit to NYC and that you enjoyed your experience at our restaurant. We take great pride in serving traditional, high-quality ramen made with the freshest ingredients. Thank you for your kind words, and we look forward to welcoming you back the next time you're in town.
Thank you for the outstanding rating, Lori-Ann! Your support is truly appreciated, and we hope to see you back soon!

owner_response: Jake, thank you for dining with us and sharing your wonderful feedback about our ramen broth. Thank you, Bruno! Your outstanding rating fills us with pride and motivation. We cherish your patronage and look forward to presenting you with more delectable sushi creations soon.

review_text: Great sushi place in the Hudson Yards neighborhood. Enjoyed everything we tried.

review_text: Just a supreme experience: fantastic food, excellent interior and exceptional friendliness. Outstanding.

review_text: The food was good. We had a party of 9, and right after we paid a big check we were told to leave despite not causing any disturbance. I’ve never felt kicked out of a restaurant before. The 20% tip was included which was not deserved after this happened. This is unfortunate because the service was good up until this occurred.
owner_response: Thank you for complimenting on the food. I’d like to clarify that your party arrived over an hour late for your 7:00 pm reservation, which impacted other guests waiting for their table. We politely requested the table back after your two-and-a-half-hour stay to accommodate a full restaurant on a busy Saturday night. Our menu asks patrons not to linger after paying, and we apply an 18% gratuity for groups of five or more. For future reservations, please ensure your group arrives on time and is considerate of other diners.

review_text: Have not heard about this place, not from here, but decided to give a try. Started off with the Bacon, and then ordered 2 of the filets. When the steak arrived, it was quite disappointing. My wife's steak was a little under, while mine on the otherhand was quite shocking. They comped the filet which was good, but on my birthday dinner sucked. Like sucked. My steak was raw and still had the white fat. Requested it medium. Returned it a 2nd time, and still the same way. Don't be fooled by the 4.4 stars, expectations aren't meeting the quality.
owner_response:
Don’t be fooled by this review. We put this under cooked Filet back on the grill ( it happens from time to time), and because we still couldn’t make you happy , we removed the filet off the check and didn’t charge you for It, but of course no mention that. We tried correct the situation. 
No real reason to write such a bad review.

review_text: Great place.  Dinner for two was fantastic!  Worth the trip
owner_response:
Hi James,

It’s wonderful to know your visit was so rewarding for both of you.

All our best, West Side Steakhouse

review_text: Steaks were ok-ish

review_text:
The food and service was amazing !
Highly recommend the Porterhouse for 2.

review_text: 牛排有點過熟，但整體而言CP值還不錯
review_text_translated: The steak was a bit overcooked, but overall the CP value was good
owner_response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback and will ensure our steaks meet your expectations next time. We're glad you found overall value satisfactory. Sincerely, West Side Steakhouse.

review_text:
인종차별 당했어요 별로입니다 맛은 쏘쏘
물 9달러
review_text_translated: I was discriminated against. It's not that good. The taste is so-so. Water is $9.
owner_response:
We're genuinely sorry to hear about your experience. It's important to us that all guests feel welcome.
However, I am offended that you think you were discriminated against, we are very proud of the fact that we have a very diverse staff (as a matter of fact the waitress who served is Eastern European, the Busser is from Bangladesh, the cooks are from Ecuador and the dishwashers are from Mexico). So, it is kind of “Racist” for you to accuse us of Discrimination because of your ethnicity.
I am sorry you did not like the food you ordered, as a note you had ample time to tell someone on our wait staff we would have taken any measure to get it right either by redoing the dish or replacing it with something else. The one thing we can’t do is read your mind. You told the wait staff you were not pleased after you finished your meal. 
Incidentally $9.00 for a bottle of a 750ml of Premium Water in a Steakhouse is not overpriced. West Side Steakhouse has been referred to as a reasonably priced steakhouse on many, many occasions. I am sorry our prices do not fit your budget but to write a 1-Star review was just totally mean spirited and I think you should really remove it.
When you go to social media you should realize that your words have consequences. This restaurant employes 14 full and part-time employees. Many are the very type of people you pretend to champion, people that work very hard to provide for their families. It’s looks to me like you want us to go out of business and my employees to lose their jobs.
I don’t know if you feel empowered or if you think you are entitled to say whatever you want, whenever you want to, but civilized people put thought behind their words.
So let me give you some words to think about, “Karma knows everyone, and it never forgets where you live”.

review_text: Excellent food, atmosphere, and service. Ribeye, Lobster, and Crabcakes were excellent.
owner_response: We're thrilled to know you enjoyed our Ribeye, Lobster, and Crabcakes! Thanks for your excellent review and we look forward to serving you again. Sincerely, West Side Steakhouse.

review_text: Had been working at the Javits center all day and was dying for a good meal. Found this quaint and quiet restaurant. review_text: Went last Saturday Night, the food, dessert, drinks were all delicious. We were not rushed out like in other restaurants. Will definitely go again.

review_text: The thai ice tea is amazing . Looking forward to comeback again.
Flexible, delicious, and quick! Loved the vibe here and definitely coming back to try more dishes !
Food was really good.

Very delicious and authentic thai food that totally brings me back to summer days in Bangkok. I’m a foodie and have try tons of Thai spot both in NY and in Thailand. I can assure you guys the Pad Kee Mao here is a must-try. It’s got that perfect smoky, charred aroma.

The sizzling beef topped with crispy garlic was perfectly tender and aromatic, while the spicy soup added a warm, comforting kick. The stir-fried noodles were rich and savory, with just the right balance of spice and freshness.
Excellent and authentic food and warm service!! Fried whole fish is awesome : )
Very delicious food
good restaurant with authentic Thai food

literally my go to place. hidden gem in hell’s kitchen, run don’t walk ❤️ the food is actually amazing, awesome staff and experience at the bar. really good pricing for how good the food is and how good the drinks are!!!   live love laugh this place
owner_response:
Dear Heysu,

So happy we could give you this amazing experience! ❤️ It means so much to hear that you enjoy everything. We work hard to make every visit special, and knowing we hit the mark really makes our day. Thank you for the love and support. Can’t wait to see you again for more great time! 

Best,

Pauline
Team Valla Table

review_text: we ordered the pad kee mao and massaman nong and both were so delicious! the pad kee mao is definitely on the spicier side, but was so yummy and flavorful. the curry was the perfect second dish to help balance out the spiciness. service was also great!
The atmosphere is just perfect for the Hell’s Kitchen vibe with amazing service and delicious authentic Thai cuisine, prices are a tiny bit high but worth it!
Great place....great food...great ambience
전형적인 메뉴같지만 그 안에 담겨있는 다채로운 맛이 인상깊었습니다. 친절한 응대는 덤으로요.
review_text_translated: It may seem like a typical menu, but the variety of flavors contained within was impressive. The friendly service was a bonus.

review_text: Below par. Definitely something is off with the 5 star reviews and average rating. Poor value for money and inexcusable portion sizes. Great location, atmosphere, and excellent staff.
The food was delicious and servers were very polite. I highly recommend the salmon salad. It was fresh and the dressing was tangy.
KT was amazing, super friendly, very informative. The food of course was THE BEST. I've Never had a better Thai Tea.

Second time coming here and as always the food was amazing! They never miss with the food and the spices, so good!
The service we got  from TK was the best! TK kept coming over to our table to check if we were doing good, if we were enjoying our food. Best server out there! Definitely recommend ya to come with your friends and family to Valla.
I never leave a review but this restaurant was literally amazing. The food was absolutely delicious, staff super attentive and friendly, and TK was amazing! Make sure to ask for him.

Wonderful Food
Friendly, offer great Recommendations, Service
The hospitality here is amazing! The food was delicious and service was quick! Would come again
Fantastic!! Best meal and atmosphere!!!
Nice Tiny restaurant with good tasting food. Beef on hot plate is nice happening :)
Good good, good service. The table felt a little cramped by the walkway. I would come back!
Good food and friendly staff
Tasty food. We ordered vegetarian Green curry and fried US wagyu. Atmosphere and service also good.
Great food, great food. Love the mock duck option in green curry
This place was fantastic! We ordered the salmon dish, pad kee mao, and duck egg wagyu rice, and I loved it all. The staff, especially May, was so kind. Highly recommend this spot!
The food was super yummy, and the service was so kind! I forgot to tell them I didn’t want ice in my drink, but they kindly gave me a new one! Will come again!
The pad mee mao and salom cubes were amazing! My personal favorite was the salmon. And our server “May” was an amazing person!
this place has good service and really nice food i love it our server May has done a great job
Delicious thai food, proper spices and flavors
The Gap Lao Nuer and Kor Moo Tod are sooooo good! Must try them!

Hands down the best Thai in the city. Everyone raved to me about it and now I am obsessed, too. Incredible service, unbeatable presentation, and amazing flavor. Having been many times, I can also say the quality is consistently impressive and the service is always impeccable.

Update (Sept 2025): it’s been two years of coming here regularly and the quality and service is still top notch, better every time! Also make sure to try all of their appetizers- so good! May was an especially helpful server who gave great recommendations!
Service was good, May suggested the Tom yum mama which was amazing and the nuer yang didn't disappoint either, recommend it 10/10
The food is great. May is very kind and the service was terrific.

I highly recommend everyone to dine at Valla Table—it’s simply amazing! Every single dish was packed with flavor. For the appetizer, I ordered a crab roll called Hoy Jaw, which was filled with crab meat and had a rich, layered taste—absolutely delicious. Then I had two main dishes: Nuer Tom Bai Horapa and Ka Peak US Wagyu. Both came in generous portions and were bursting with incredible flavor.

For drinks, I chose a Thai iced tea, and the very first sip completely blew me away. To finish, I ordered a coconut cake for dessert. I couldn’t even wait to take a picture before digging in—it was that tempting! The cake was full of rich coconut aroma and flavor. From the main dishes to the dessert and drinks, everything tasted authentically Thai.

Our server, May, was warm, attentive, and provided excellent service. Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience, and I truly recommend this place to everyone!
美味しかったです！
review_text_translated: It was delicious!

review_text: My palate was challenged in the most pleasant way. The restaurant maintains a simple, pleasant vibe. The staff demonstrate excellent service skills. The cuisine reflects genuine tradition. I'm looking forward to returning to this restaurant.

A comida é muito boa, excelente opção em NY para brasileiros com saudades de uma boa comida! Mas o atendimento não foi atencioso, na verdade bem "seco" e a atendente, embora brasileira, respondia tudo em inglês e de forma rude!!!
review_text_translated: The food is very good, an excellent option in NY for Brazilians missing good food! But the service was not attentive, in fact quite "dry," and the waitress, although Brazilian, answered everything in English and rudely!!!
owner_response:
Olá, muito obrigado pelo seu feedback! Ficamos felizes que tenha gostado da comida. Sentimos muito que o atendimento não tenha sido como esperado — não é de forma alguma a nossa intenção. Já conversamos com a equipe para garantir que isso não se repita.

Esperamos recebê-lo novamente em breve para uma experiência ainda melhor.

review_text:
One of the best stakes you can have.

This Brazilian restaurant will blow you away

Knowing that our service and dining experience stood out to you truly means a lot to our team. We look forward to welcoming you back soon for more meals worth sharing!

review_text: Comida maravilhosa, muito saborosa, pra matar a saudade do tempero brasileiro. Ambiente e atendimento muito bons. As porções são muito bem servidas. Vale a pena a experiência.

Thank you for a lovely meal! We will be back soon!

review_text: There food is great there nachos are so so like where is the meat they cheap with all the rest of the ingredients but the other platters n drinks no complains

review_text: Ресторан мне очень понравился! Все было очень вкусно. Официанты приятные, быстро принесли заказ. Превосходный стейк, очень вкусные креветки с грибами в соусе. Рекомендую.

owner_response: Thank you so much for your kind words! We’re so happy you enjoyed the steak, shrimp, and your experience with us. We can’t wait to welcome you back to Rice X Beans soon!

review_text:
In my last job, we had an employee who ran our Latin American customer service department and she was straight out of Brazil. Naturally, I had to pick her brain on where the best Brazilian food in Manhattan was, and the only place she would really hang her hat on was Rice X Beans in Hells Kitchen.

A year later, I cashed in this mental note and made the push to the intersection of 10th Ave and 48th street with my big bro.

We sat down and were greeted by our server who had a strong Brazilian accent, which got me excited. It screamed authenticity. It’s crazy how a simple accent from a server can send me from Manhattan straight to a small restaurant in Rio.

We scanned the menu and I thought it was interesting how there seemed to be a strong Caribbean influence, as there were empanadas and sweet plantains… but a quick google search tells me that plantains are originally from Southeast Asia and Empanadas originated in Spain. The more I learn about the world, the more I realize I truly know nothing.

We went with 4 empanadas (2 beef and 2 chicken), BBQ ribs ($16), the Picanha for 2 ($70), and a side of plantains.

The empanadas were sensational, but in hindsight we should have just got 4 beef as they were much more flavorful than the chicken. Hindsight is always 20/20 though.

The ribs were the only real miss of the meal, as they were just a bit bland and served luke warm, which concerned me for the main event that was the Picanha.

However, when that Picanha came I knew we were in good hands. An enormous portion of the iconic Brazilian style top sirloin that came with fries, farofa, rice, beans, and a side salad. It was so much food that it barely fit on our table for 2. A beautiful site.

This steak was perfectly medium rare, well seasoned, and had a rich, beefy flavor with a buttery melt-in-your-mouth fat cap. The sides were an ideal pairing with this cut of steak, with the rice and plantains being the standouts. This was almost like a jasmine rice where you could taste each individual grain, and had a subtle garlic and onion flavor.

These plantains were some of the best I’ve had in the city, as they were carmelized with a soft and tender texture. They taste even better than they looked which is saying A LOT.

I sound like a broken record at this point, but it always amazes me how in New York, you can get a high level of any cuisine from across this beautiful planet. Also, shoutout to my former coworker for the rec. You can learn something from everyone.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__
The beef skirt steak was tuff and the caipirinha is way overpriced at $25. I couldn’t even taste any evidence of alcohol. Do better. You should remember not to bring the customer dirty utensils!!
owner_response:
We’re sorry to hear about your experience. We take pride in offering quality food, drinks, and service, and it’s clear we missed the mark during your visit. Your feedback about the skirt steak, caipirinha, and utensils has been noted, and we’ll address this with our team to ensure it doesn’t happen again.

Thank you for letting us know.
Thank you for your review, Dally! We hope to see you soon!

review_text: Good Cost to be NY
owner_response: Thank you for your review, Cristobal! We look forward to seeing you all again soon!
Thank you for your review, Carmen! Looking forward to seeing you again soon.

review_text:
Wonderful Brazilian restaurant, great service. Ordered the Strogonofe de camarão. It was delicious, it tastes like real Brazilian food (not the americanized, or latin version of it)

If you want to taste your Brazilian comida da avó, this is the place

Thank you for your review, Helena!
Thank you so much for your review, Gabriela!

review_text: Loved the food. Highly recommended.

review_text: Granted I went for late lunch on a Wednesday but I loved the decor and ambiance and most especially I loved the food. I swear I have never met a moqueca I did not like, this one is no exception. Their moqueca do mar is full of fish and seafood, rich flavors I absolutely love it, It’s my favorite dish! Of course can’t go without caipirinha which is so classic as well. Will come back when I can but Brazilian food in New York does not disappoint ♥️🇧🇷
owner_response: Thank you so much for the kind words! We're so happy to hear you enjoyed the moqueca — it’s a classic we’re proud of. And of course, you can’t go wrong with a caipirinha! We really appreciate you sharing your experience and hope to see you again soon. 💛🇧🇷

review_text: Arrived at the restaurant at 10pm and the server said they cannot server us because they are closed. There were people inside and google maps clearly says it closes at 11pm. I wasn’t my trip there :/

Our restaurant closes at 10pm on Sundays, and we do list that in our official hours on Google and our website. That said, third-party platforms like Google Maps can sometimes display outdated information. For the most accurate updates, we recommend checking our Instagram @ricexbeans_. We really appreciate you taking the time to share this and hope to have the chance to welcome you back soon for a better experience.
