review_text:
Amazing food and even better service
Highly recommended
I really don’t know why people leave bad reviews here. It was the best food in NYC after all those tasting from Michelin 3-1 stars. Wish I could give them 100 stars!

We were a party of 7 people with a very spacious table. Our server was incredibly attentive to the table all night. Having never been before we were guided by him on what to order. Each dish was better than the next. Fresh sushi, A-5 Wagyu steak incredible, whole branzino, gnocchi pillows, shrimp in pasta. Dessert platter was over the top. Great vibe with people dancing in the aisles and on their chairs. Fun night for any age.
Fabulous food. Fun party atmosphere. Had the best time 🎉 Highly recommend 🍷

What an incredible experience!! Food and service were phenomenal!! And oh what fun!!  Hasalon becomes alive with music and dancing on the chairs and everywhere! What a fun night!! We will definitely be back!!!

I am surprised to see ANY negative reviews. I just celebrated my best friends Bachelorette Party here this past weekend. Everything was spectacular…Service, food, atmosphere, etc! All I had to do was give our server the slightest glance & they were back with a fresh glass of bubbly within secs. To say our expectations were exceeded is an understatement. Well worth the price since it wasn’t just a dinner…it was truly an experience! Highly recommend for any special occasion. Only negative I could assume is the environment is def curated by the patrons along with staff. This collective was not shy! Dancing on tables, napkins in air, confetti tossing, & plate smashing GALORE!
The food was good [although overpriced ] and our waiters/service was great, however, the Dj is terrible and their management staff harasses guests. 2 stars for food/service

I have never encountered a restaurant manager who treats their customers like garbage. In what world does a manager not even try to understand the problem with the service they’re providing? Instead of trying to resolve an issue with a customer’s order, he just yells at the customer and makes them feel completely humiliated! Zero professionalism! A person like that should not be managing a place where customer service is key! He should be ashamed of himself! Absolutely disgusting! I will never go back to this place, ever! And I will never recommend a place that doesn’t make its customers feel comfortable! As someone who works with people, I always treat them the way I would want to be treated. But apparently, he isn’t even human. If I were him, I’d resign.

The worst experience and attitude ever had in a Restaurant

Dear Hasalon team,

My friend and I came in with the excitement of trying out as many dishes as we could, but unfortunately, we encountered a frustrating experience.
We had some difficulty understanding the menu, and we ended up ordering the Shawarma dish and the Wagyu steak dish. However, we were served two dishes that looked very similar — not what we were expecting or hoping for. When we kindly tried to return the second dish, the manager insisted we keep it and told us, “What would you do if you had a restaurant?”
This interaction made us feel very uncomfortable, and honestly, it took away our appetite and desire to stay and enjoy the rest of the meal.
We wanted to share this feedback in the hope that future guests might have a better, more respectful experience.

Im going to write on both languages so everyone will understand.
I came with a friend to this restaurant and expected to enjoy the food and the music.
The menu was hard for us to understand so when we ordered one of the dishes it was different from our expectations. We asked kindly to return the dish. THE MANAGER CAME TO OUR TABLE MAD!
Said it was our problem for not understanding the dish, forced us to eat the dish when we are telling him we don’t want this dish !! He left the table after that attitude. We were so confused. We gave the dish to one of the waiters and told him to tell the manager that we really don’t want this dish please take it. THE MANAGER CAME BACK WITH BIGGER ATTITUDE!! Telling us that it’s our fault !! I saw he was attacking my friend while she was trying to explain that it’s just not what we were expecting. I told him that there is no reason to be hard on it and everything is ok . He just looked at me said OK and left. To be honest our night was ruined because of his attitude towards us. We just paid the bill we don’t mind to pay it really! We are just in shock from this service !!!

אני וחברה שלי יצאנו לאכול במסעדה הזאת ורצינו להנות מהאווירה והאוכל. בגלל שהתפריט לא היה ברור לנו יצא שהזמנו מנה שונה ממה שחשבנו שתהיה. ביקשנו מהמלצרית פשוט לקחת את המנה הזאת בחזרה בגלל אי הבנה. הגיע המנהל של המקום!! שם לנו את המנה בחזרה על השולחן!! הם גישה מתגוננת מראש ותוקפנית ואומר לנו מה הבעיה ?? אנחנו מסבירות לו שזאת לא המנה שציפינו שתהיה והוא מתחיל להגיד שזאת בעיה שלנו ואשמתנו שלא הבנו את המנה והכריח אותנו לאכול אותה !! הוא עזב את השולחן ונשארנו בהלםםםם !! ביקשתי ממלצר אחר לקחת את המנה מהשולחן כי אנחנו מסתכלות על זה ואומרות אנחנו לא רוצות את המנה הזאת בבקשה תקחו אותה מפה. המנהל שוב פעם חזר והפעם עוד יותר עצבני!! ממשיך להאשים אותנו שזה בעיה שלנו שלא הבנו את המנה וכשראיתי אותה צועק על חברה שלי ומנסה להביך אותה על האי הבנה שאלתי אותו למה הוא כלכך קשה עם לקוחות ?? הכל טוב.. הוא פשוט הסתכל לי בעיניים דפק פרצוף אמר ״טוב״. והלך. האמת היא שכבר לא נשאר לנו תאבון לאכול את שאר המנות הוא ממש הרס לנו את המצב רוח.. באמת שאין לנו בעיה לשלם את החשבון אבל וואלה זה לא על הכסף זה פשוט על השירות המזעזע הזה. אני מקווה שאתה קורא את זה ולומד מזה. זאת לא דרך לדבר ככה עם לקוחות וזאת לא הגישה. ויש גישה לכל דבר אנחנו סך הכל התבלבלנו במנות מותר ללקוח להתבלבל הכל טוב ..
review_text_translated:
I'm going to write in both languages so everyone will understand.
I came with a friend to this restaurant and expected to enjoy the food and the music.
The menu was hard for us to understand so when we ordered one of the dishes it was different from our expectations. We asked kindly to return the dish. THE MANAGER CAME TO OUR TABLE MAD!
Said it was our problem for not understanding the dish, forced us to eat the dish when we are telling him we don't want this dish!! He left the table after that attitude. We were so confused. We gave the dish to one of the waiters and told him to tell the manager that we really don't want this dish please take it. THE MANAGER CAME BACK WITH BIGGER ATTITUDE!! Telling us that it's our fault!! I saw he was attacking my friend while she was trying to explain that it's just not what we were expecting. I told him that there is no reason to be hard on it and everything is ok . He just looked at me said OK and left. To be honest our night was ruined because of his attitude towards us. We just paid the bill we don’t mind paying it really! We are just in shock from this service !!!

My friend and I went out to eat at this restaurant and we wanted to enjoy the atmosphere and the food. Because the menu was not clear to us it turned out that we ordered a different dish than what we thought it would be. We asked the waitress to simply take this dish back due to a misunderstanding. The manager of the place arrived!! He put the dish back on the table for us!! He has a defensive and aggressive attitude and tells us what the problem is?? We explain to him that this is not the dish we expected and he starts saying that it is our problem and it is our fault that we did not understand the dish and forced us to eat it!! He left the table and we were shocked!! I asked another waiter to take the dish from the table because we were looking at it and saying we don't want this dish, please take it away. The manager came back again and this time was even more angry!! He kept accusing us that it was our problem that we didn't understand the dish and when I saw her yelling at my friend and trying to embarrass her for the misunderstanding I asked him why he was so hard on customers?? Everything is fine.. He just looked me in the eye, made a face and said "fine". And left. The truth is that we no longer had any appetite left to eat the rest of the dishes. He really ruined our mood.. We really have no problem paying the bill but wow, it's not about the money, it's just about this shocking service. I hope you read this and learn from it. This is not the way to talk to customers and this is not the attitude. And there is an attitude to everything. We just got confused about the dishes. The customer is allowed to get confused. Everything is fine..

review_text_translated:

The food is simply amazing, with an emphasis on the mushroom, it is definitely the most delicious I have ever eaten in my life, the flavors are accurate
A successful experience and I will definitely return

review_text:
Disappointing, Overpriced, and Not Worth the Hype – Avoid HaSalon NYC

We came to HaSalon as a group of five, expecting a fun night with good food and drinks. What we got instead was a frustrating and disappointing experience that felt more like a scam than a high-end dining experience.

We weren’t very hungry, so we ordered a few dishes (3–4 total) and a bottle of wine, thinking we’d enjoy a light meal and focus more on drinks. Shortly after, our waitress came over and told us there’s a minimum spend of $100 per person – on food only. We were surprised. We politely explained that we weren’t here to eat heavily, just to enjoy the vibe and have drinks. But she insisted, saying it’s policy and there’s no way around it.

We asked to speak with the manager, who offered to “help” by creating a menu that would meet the $100 per person food minimum – that’s $500 total, not including alcohol. Not ideal, but we went along with it just to salvage the night.

At the end of the night, the bill came to over $1,000, including just $200 worth of drinks, meaning we had been forced to spend way more on mediocre food. To top it off, they automatically added a 20% tip per person, which felt outrageous given the experience.

The food? Mostly average. A couple of dishes were borderline flavorless, and only the steak stood out as truly good. Everything else was forgettable or disappointing. For the price and pressure, this felt less like a fine dining experience and more like a money grab.

Between the hidden minimums, the aggressive upselling, and the mediocre food, HaSalon was a complete letdown. I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone – there are far better places to spend your money and enjoy yourself in NYC.
Love this place.  So fun!  And food is great.
Reservations needed. Cute fun atmosphere!

I took a star out because it’s WAY too expensive. That being said the food was all amazing. Each dish was so good. I especially loved the mushroom steak. And the lemon gnocchi was insanely good we had to order more. The drinks are good but not amazing. But I wouldn’t come here unless you are celebrating something special like a birthday because it’s more about the party atmosphere which is so fun. They start the party at 10:45 so I recommend coming earlier to eat.
My fav place ever ! Vibes on vibes !

Well, this place is quite unique — not so much for the food, but for the incredible ambiance. People were singing and dancing on tables, the waiters offered us shots and were super friendly, and we ended up chatting with lots of other guests. We had a great time and shared a lot of laughs!

That said, it’s definitely overpriced. We spent $500 for two people, which feels steep considering the food was just okay — good, but not remarkable. The first bottle of wine starts at $105, though I have to admit the Mercurey we chose was excellent ($135, compared to about €60 online, so fair enough).

In conclusion, if you’re looking for a wild, festive night out and you’re not too worried about the bill, this spot delivers on atmosphere and fun. Just don’t come expecting culinary excellence.
Super loud and very expensive

This restaurant concept makes sense if you have no idea what things cost or maybe have never dined in a restaurant before. $30 vegetable dishes, $50 pastas, etc. Many dishes feature mid-quality caviar and/or truffles to justify the exorbitant pricing.

The chef's other casual concepts are far more reasonably priced, so maybe the premium is for the atmosphere and "party" environment, but it all feels a bit forced. No bread dish is worth $20 or fig salad worth $30, even in NYC.

I had an amazing time at HaSalon NYC! We managed to get a last-minute reservation, and despite how busy the night was, the staff was incredibly welcoming and attentive. The food was outstanding—just as great as I remember from the original restaurant in Tel Aviv. The energy, the atmosphere, and the overall experience made it a perfect spot for a birthday or any kind of celebration.
I would not come back here. It was obnoxiously loud, to the point where I was yelling just to speak to someone sitting across from me. The staff was great but the food left a lot to be desired.
Food was amazing, the vibe was on point, and make sure you get later reservations so you can stay for the party! It was epic.

It makes sense to come here for the later reservation to enjoy the few hours before closing, because that’s when the music turns up and people start dancing. I can’t say the food was bad — it wasn’t spectacular — some things (like the steak) were delicious, while others were meh. But I can definitely say that it was overpriced. We eat dinner in NYC all the time — if you charge like $50 for small apps, I have certain expectations, and they are not met when it’s 1/2 of a potato with sour cream. The portions were comically small, and we were starving despite ordering more than what the waitress recommended. Ended up getting pizza across the street after. Good pizza, but that’s sad after you’ve spent a few bills per person at a restaurant. The cocktails were good and the wine list had very good options. I got the feeling that the food isn’t really their “thing” — it’s like a cover charge for groups of people to come and get drunk and dance, around others who can afford it. People were getting up on the tables and chairs and dancing, after the evening reached a certain point. It was a pretty fun experience, especially if you don’t expect it. I would recommend this place for a larger group that wants to drink, dance, and snack, but not for dinner or restaurant/food enthusiasts.
A very fun experience. The place turns into a party by the end of the night. The portions are small but tasty. Staff are friendly and helpful.

mediocre at best, will not be back. should've spent it at the tables. or the slots. or given it away to a random person and tell them to bet it all and at least make their night. i'd say "nice try," but i didn't see the effort.

Food is okay but very salty, atmosphere is getting better but only by the last hour before closing. they let guests dance on tables.
Service  is very poor and obnoxious.  Music is loud and old.  The crowd is mostly Jewish
Ambiance Exceptionnelle, quelle soirée
review_text_translated: Exceptional atmosphere, what an evening

review_text: Prices are high the food is not bad although somewhat salty. The portions are on the small side the service is good and the atmosphere is good as well.

שירות מזעזע. הגענו וקיבלנו רק מנות ראשונות כי המלצר פשוט שיקר שלעולם לא הזמנו עיקריות ובכלל אין אותם בתפריט (שהוא ממש סימן על התפריט מה אנחנו מזמינים) וגם המנהל שקרא לו לא עזר בכלום ולא הציע אפילו פיתרון. יצאנו רעבים.
review_text_translated: Shocking service. We arrived and only received appetizers because the waiter simply lied that we never ordered main courses and they weren't on the menu at all (which actually indicated on the menu what we were ordering) and even the manager who called him didn't help at all and didn't even offer a solution. We left hungry.

review_text: The food at hasalon was inedible. We were seated at the bar even though there were open tables. No server came to us, we had to flag them down. The drinks were less than mid. Even the manager was rude to us. Would never go back and neither should you!

Super good food and really good wine selection to choose from
This is a gem.
The food was amazing ! The staff was really friendly ! The atmosphere was a 10/10 if you want a romantic dinner!
Great food, but the service could be improved especially from the manager and the host.
Authentic food. No sauce fest here. Small menu means more attention. The maccu siciliano was like my mother makes back in the homeland. Bruschetta piled with tomato not overly garlic. I left stuffed.
Love the risotto. The tiramisu is also amazing. Will definitely come back to try out all the desserts;)

bella sorpresa questo piccolo ristorante in zona hell's kitchen. Il proprietario e lo chef italiani di seconda generazione sanno come cucinare italiano. ottima la pasta. buoni gli spaghetti, le fettuccine al ragù e i ravioli. anche il pesce che abbiamo ordinato (salmone) era buono e si presentava bene. buon servizio e cordialità. il prezzo è giusto.
non c'erano molte persone alle 8.30 quando siamo arrivati quindi abbiamo goduto anche di tranquillità. attenzione agli orari però perché la ciò a potrebbe chiudere dopo le 21.
review_text_translated:
This little restaurant in the Hell's Kitchen area was a lovely surprise. The owner and second-generation Italian chef know how to cook Italian food. The pasta was excellent, as were the spaghetti, fettuccine with meat sauce, and ravioli. The fish we ordered (salmon) was also good and beautifully presented. The service was good and friendly. The price was fair.
There weren't many people at 8:30 when we arrived, so we enjoyed the quiet atmosphere. Be careful with the opening hours, though, as the restaurant might close after 9:00 PM.

review_text: Everything was delicious. Not too busy for an early Friday dinner. Highly recommend the artichoke cake and the daily salad. Desserts (cestino, tiramisu) were well plated and very good. Try to get a seat by the window to enjoy the ambience of a quieter part of Hell's Kitchen. Would definitely come here again!

Server was helpful in recommending our meals. Prices were reasonable. Small little restaurant sitting so you might want to get there early. Also before 6:00 they offer a 10% discount on your total bill. What's not to like.
Just amazing. Best Italian in a long time.
Ristorante molto carino con una bella atmosfera, personale gentilissimo, ottima cucina italiana. Tutto molto buono
review_text_translated: Very nice restaurant with a lovely atmosphere, very friendly staff, excellent Italian cuisine. Everything was very good.

review_text: So good!  Any of the homemade pastas look great. We had our machete. My pork chop was a little overcooked, but tasted great.  Nice staff, reasonably priced wine.

A truly authentic Italian NYC dining experience as the owner frequented our table to check on us and regale us with stories of his family and the rich tradition of the dishes we so thoroughly enjoyed.
We started with a traditional bruschetta - fresh chopped tomatoes in divine EVOO. topped with arugula on crispy bread. The Sicilian insalata was a perfect blend of Fennel, orange, arugula, olives, oregano, red pepper flakes, EVOO. The flavors blending together to make this better than any dinner salad. The penne with pomodoro sauce was a delicious choice for our entree. A flavorful tomato sauce served with al dente pasta and fresh basil.
For wine we chose a Pinot Grigio and a Chianti. Both excellent choices to accent our food. We ended with tiramisu -Dark espresso, mascarpone, whipped cream and lady fingers, sambuca and limoncello.
The ambience is set for romance with its intimate space and simple Italian inspired decor. A small restaurant with a big heart.
Sehr gute italienische Küche! Schönes und sauberes Restaurant. Sehr netter Service!
review_text_translated: Very good Italian cuisine! Beautiful and clean restaurant. Very friendly service!

review_text: My nonna couldn't have done it better!

Super! Very good food, beautiful ambiance, warm welcome, authentic European style atmosphere and presentation. Including a bit of a lip when asking for some extra bread after 9pm! Apparently, not allowed 😂. Otherwise, 💯. Enjoyed this Italian bistro after the James S hospitality industry wine event very much! Bravo 👌

I had such a delightful dinner here. Every dish we ordered was delicious, and the ingredients were fresh. I’ve eaten at so many restaurants in New York, but this little spot in Hell’s Kitchen really surprised me—it’s become one of my favorites in the city.

We've been a few times now and I always walk away well-fed and happy. This time they went above and beyond. Food was absolutely excellent, the drinks were impeccable (the basil margarita especially), and the service is top-notch. Easily one of my favorite places to go before a show.
Food was good but portions small.   Very tight space. Helpful with scooter
The food was absolutely delicious! Our waiter was very attentive and the restaurant itself had just the right ambience and vibe.
The service, atmosphere and food were perfect!

Comida italiana bien preparada  y con porciones normales, no muy abundante.  El lugar está un poco alejado del movimiento turístico lo que facilita llegar en automóvil y aparcar casi en la misma puerta
review_text_translated: Well-prepared Italian food with average portions, not too abundant. The place is a bit off the beaten path, making it easy to get there by car and park right outside the door.

review_text: Good was really good, high five to the chef!! Cute little place for authentic Italian food

Tucked away in the charming town of Innsbruck, this gem of an Italian restaurant absolutely blew us away. From the moment we walked in, the service was warm and welcoming, and every dish that hit our table tasted like it came straight from a kitchen in Sicily.

The pasta was fresh, the sauces were rich and balanced, and the flavors? Bellissimo. It honestly might be the best Italian meal I’ve had outside of Italy — and I’ve tried more than a few.

If you’re anywhere near Innsbruck, Austria, do yourself a favor and make a reservation. This place is unforgettable.

Intiem zaakje waar reserveren geboden is. Er komt geweldig eten uit de keuken: de gegrilde inktvis was magisch van smaak en ook de ravioli van kalfsvlees met salie was perfect. Heerlijke wijn erbij. Topzaak!
review_text_translated: Intimate place where reservations are required. The food comes out of the kitchen wonderfully: the grilled squid was magical in taste and the ravioli of veal with sage was also perfect. Delicious wine with it. Top place!

review_text: At the end of our meal, the manager went out of his way to insist he hadn't made a mistake with a drink (which he had made incorrectly).  It wasn't a big deal, but  the whole exchange was off putting and weird.  Even the waiter apologized for his behavior. You got some morons in charge of the restaurant.

Every dish and drink I’ve had has been absolutely delicious. The service is always fantastic and the atmosphere is very pleasant. My favorite dish has to be the eggplant parmigiana and my favorite drink is the Hugo spritz. I’ve eaten here many times and will continue to do so, never disappoints.

Merely two blocks away from the overcrowded Broadway, we were very happy with our dining experience. All food was so well and freshly prepared and tasty to the max! Great little restaurant and worth a visit for sure!

We ordered the pasta al pomodoro and the tagliatelle al ragù, absolutely delicious!
Real Italian food with fresh ingredients, authentic flavors, and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. The service was excellent.
We'll definitely be back!
Man this dinner was absolutely fantastic. Would HIGHLY recommend! Amazing food and service and the ambience was exactly what we were looking for. Can’t wait to come back to this lovely place 💜
Fabulous food and service!

Il Melograno offers some of the best Italian food in NYC! The ambiance is cozy and chic, perfect for a date night with its quiet and intimate atmosphere.

We started with the Carpaccio di Angus, which was fresh and delicious, topped with arugula, asparagus, and Parmigiano. For the main course, I had the Filetto di Salmone—perfectly cooked salmon with a rich butter-lemon sauce, cauliflower puree, and grilled asparagus. My boyfriend had the Pappardelle al Ragu di Salsiccia, and he was thoroughly impressed with the pasta.

We finished with a creamy dessert that was the perfect way to end the meal. The portions were generous, and the prices were more than reasonable for the quality of the food. Service was top-notch—attentive and friendly. Highly recommend, and we’ll definitely be back!

Food is average. Overcooked pasta, I wish they would make it al dente. Octopus was rubbery and pork chop was dry. Generally most dishes were under-seasoned. Wine selection is good with decent prices for the US. Service and atmosphere were good.

I recently celebrated my 40th birthday at Il Melograno, and I must say, it was nothing short of spectacular! From the moment we started planning the event to the evening itself, the proprietors, Lino and Gregory, went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect.

The ambiance of Il Melograno is both cozy and chic, providing the ideal backdrop for a memorable evening with friends. We opted for a pre-fixe menu, which was expertly curated to cater to a variety of dietary preferences, including vegetarian and pescatarian options. Each dish, from the shared appetizers to the delectable desserts, was beautifully presented and delicious.

What truly set this experience apart was the exceptional service. Lino and Gregory’s attention to detail, accommodating nature, and warm hospitality made us feel truly special. They even surprised me with a stunning bouquet – a gesture that touched my heart deeply.

For anyone looking for a venue that offers not only exquisite Italian cuisine but also personalized and caring service, Il Melograno is the place to go. I am already looking forward to my next visit!

Thank you, Lino and Gregory, for making my 40th birthday an evening to remember. I cannot recommend Il Melograno highly enough!
This place is perfect. Excellent staff and food. Great before a show
Had a fantastic dinner here before seeing a Broadway show. Everything was wonderful from the food to the service to the cozy atmosphere, would highly recommend it!
Excellent food and service in quaint setting. Staff were all amazing and food oh so yummy. Orecchiette dish, burrata were amazing.

A true gem!
Delicious fresh, clean food and authentic to southern Italy cuisine.
The service is s excellent and the owners satisfy any request that's asked.
A real find!

Une expérience parfaite du début à la fin ! Le restaurant Melograno a largement été à la hauteur de nos espérances. L’accueil chaleureux, les plats savoureux et l’ambiance conviviale ont rendu notre soirée mémorable. Tout était absolument délicieux, avec une attention particulière portée aux détails. Un endroit que je recommande vivement et où nous reviendrons sans hésiter !
Merci encore ❤️
review_text_translated:
A perfect experience from start to finish! Melograno Restaurant more than lived up to our expectations. The warm welcome, delicious dishes, and friendly atmosphere made our evening memorable. Everything was absolutely delicious, with meticulous attention to detail. A place I highly recommend and will definitely return to!
Thank you again ❤️

review_text:
We had an excellent meal with wonderful service and great wine. The food is truly amazing . Even the espresso and cannolo were delicious. I’m Sicilian 🇮🇹 so I know.
Thank you all including Jose , Philip and Leo. Grazie Mille

Absolutely delicious food, every dish was incredible. Well-balanced unique flavors, beautiful presentation, good portion sizes. Many gluten free (celiac friendly!) options for appetizers, entrees, and even desserts. Make sure to talk to your waiter, besides pasta nothing is marked as gluten free on the menu but there are tons of options. Our waiter was super friendly and knowledgeable and the atmosphere was great. Highly recommend!

Il Melagrano is a short walk from our apartment. We recently made a reservation for dinner and have returned 5 times since.  We love this restaurant. The food, the service and atmosphere are all top notch. My husband and I highly recommend the salmon, swordfish, stripped bass (a special), the pork chop, the chicken Milanese, the veal ravioli - in short everything we ordered was prepared with great care for flavor and balance.  The salads, soups and appetizers are all varied enough with daily specials to choose from to make repeat visits a must.  The service is friendly and meals delivered hot from the kitchen.  We’ve noticed that several early guests chose this restaurant before going to the theatre which is a few blocks east.

We only wish we’d found il melagrano sooner.

Doug and Dan   NYC
